headline: Man Utd name Aaron Wan-Bissaka price as Red Devils set to make huge loss
body: Manchester United may be about to take a huge financial hit on Aaron Wan-Bissaka with an Old Trafford exit potentially on the cards five years after his £50m move
Manchester United are willing to take a £35million hit on Aaron Wan-Bissaka amid a potential summer exit.

The right-back has endured a mixed time at Old Trafford since moving north from Crystal Palace back in 2019. He was the first major signing of the Ole Gunnar Solskjaer era and set the club back £50m as they pounced following a huge breakout year for the right-back.

Originally a regular, Wan-Bissaka has been in and out of the first-team with Diogo Dalot often preferred. He has played in notable games under Erik ten Hag, but the club are still willing to sanction his departure.

West Ham are among those keen and could land the former Palace defender for £15m. The Hammers and United are reportedly locked in talks over a potential deal, according to talkSPORT, with the Red Devils triggering a 12-month extension in his deal to stop him leaving for nothing this summer.

He has made 190 appearances for United, scoring twice, but he could soon find himself at the London Stadium as the Red Devils look to get players off their books to help finance their summer business with more new signings on Ten Hag's wish list.
This time last year the United boss admitted that Wan-Bissaka "was out in the cold and looked like he was on his way out of Manchester United" before his performances landed him another season.

The former Palace man, who was once tipped for England but is yet to land international recognition, has admitted he thought his career in Manchester was up as soon as Ten Hag arrived before knuckling down to extend his time at Old Trafford.

He said previously: "It was a hard time and the only thing you can do during a hard time is keep working. I got my head down and then got the chance and was able to help the team. You can just sit there and complain about it and not care, or you can actually try and I thought the best way was for me to try."

Last term Wan-Bissaka started 20 times in the Premier League but United are attempting to bolster their backline as they close in on the £52m capture of Leny Yoro from Lille. Matthijs de Ligt and Jarrad Branthwaite are also on their shortlist.

headline: Adrien Rabiot set for fresh Man Utd talks after making transfer decision
body: Juventus midfielder Adrien Rabiot is free to hold talks with other clubs after running down his contract in Italy with Liverpool and Manchester United among his suitors
Adrien Rabiot will hold talks with Liverpool and Manchester United in the coming days after leaving Juventus.
The Frenchman, 29, became a free agent at the start of the month after running down his contract at the Allianz Stadium and will officially announce his departure from the Italian giants this week.

That decision is likely to lead to a number of top European clubs making their move - and the midfield maestro will explore a move to the Premier League amid interest from two of England's biggest clubs.
Rabiot intends to speak with all of his suitors as he weighs up his next move, as outlined by Football Italia, including Liverpool and United.
Newcastle are another club who are set to hold discussions with Rabiot, while AC Milan and Napoli, now managed by Antonio Conte, will attempt to persuade him to remain in Italy.
Rabiot is looking for a contract worth £7.5m a year: a sum that may be too rich for clubs in Serie A. Juventus offered a base salary of £5.8m in their final contract offer.
Rabiot has been regularly linked with a move to the Premier League in recent years and Manchester United are long-term admirers of the midfielder.

Rabiot was in talks with the Red Devils when he was still on the books at Paris-Saint Germain before then-manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer decided against pushing ahead with a deal. And Rabiot was back on the club's radar following the appointment of Erik ten Hag, but again, a deal failed to materialise.

United are in the market for midfield reinforcements this summer and are believed to be pursuing Manuel Ugarte. However, the club have a limited transfer budget and as the close on Leny Yoro, will likely need to sell before being able to complete a deal for the Uruguay international - and the fact that they could land Rabiot without have to pay a transfer fee could appeal.

Manchester United landed Joshua Zirkzee from Bologna at the weekend and are also poised to complete the signing of Lille prodigy Yoro after persuading the coveted teenager to join them ahead of Real Madrid.

headline: Leny Yoro transfer leaves Erik ten Hag with headache after Man Utd promise
body: Manchester United are closing in on defensive target Leny Yoro, with the Lille defender headed for the UK for discussions, but Erik tan Hag has more work to do this summer
Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag may be forced to abandon one of his other defensive targets if the club completes a deal for Leny Yoro, with the Dutchman also facing a selection dilemma.

French teenager Yoro had appeared to favour Real Madrid over an Old Trafford switch, but things have taken a turn with Los Blancos failing to match United's £52m bid. The Lille starlet is on his way to Manchester for a medical, with a deal seemingly imminent.

This was always likely to be a busy summer for the Premier League club, with defenders Raphael Varane and Willy Kambwala both leaving and Victor Lindelof linked with a move away. Yoro is one of a number of players targeted, along with Matthijs de Ligt and Jarrad Branthwaite, but his arrival could well see one of those names drop off the list.

Mirror Football understands Ten Hag has told De Ligt he plans to offer him regular first-team football, something the ex-Ajax star isn't guaranteed at current club Bayern Munich. However, with Lisandro Martinez one of the first names on the teamsheet under Ten Hag, it could be left-sided defender Branthwaite who ends up staying put.
Former Premier League midfielder Remy Cabella has been among those to bang the drum for Yoro. The 34-year-old, formerly of Newcastle United, played with the teenager at Lille last season.

"At Marseille, I knew Boubacar Kamara, at Saint-Etienne, William Saliba and Wesley Fofana, and now there's Leny Yoro," the French international said, per Goal. "He has all the qualities and potential to do something huge. He's very humble, and that's another of his strengths."

Despite only turning 18 in November, Yoro developed into a regular at Lille last term. He played 44 times in all competitions, scoring three times, as Les Dogues finished fourth in Ligue 1 and reached the quarter-finals of the Europa Conference League.

United, who finished in eighth place in the Premier League last season, have already begun their summer rebuild. It is their first transfer window of the INEOS era, with part-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe hiring Dan Ashworth, Omar Berrada and Jason Wilcox to take charge of the club's business.

Joshua Zirkzee has already joined, with a £36.5m move from Bologna completed over the weekend. The former Bayern Munich forward will provide competition for Rasmus Hojlund up front following the departure of Cristiano Ronaldo and Anthony Martial during Ten Hag's two years as manager.

“He’s a player who can link up the game, who can be available, hold up the ball, have good ideas, be creative and who can dribble in combinations,” Ten Hag said of Zirkzee. “So that's a different type [of player] and always what we are looking for, so it gives us more options tactically, which is good.
“Particularly up front, we have many players who can play very direct, so they can take a big benefit for his skills.”

headline: Man Utd transfer news: Leny Yoro breakthrough achieved as Mason Greenwood profit banked
body: Manchester United are pushing for their second signing of the summer as they reach an agreement with Lille over Leny Yoro having already landed Joshua Zirkzee from Bologna
Manchester United have already landed a deal for Joshua Zirkzee and a second could be inbound in the form of Leny Yoro.

The Red Devils have ramped up their transfer activity in recent weeks, which has coincided with the arrival of Dan Ashworth as sporting director. Erik ten Hag's position was confirmed shortly after the FA Cup victory and he's set about targeting problem areas in the squad.

Defensive recruits - as well as more firepower - are likely to be their main priorities. They also retain an interest in PSG's Manuel Ugarte but they are working with a limited budget and may have to offload players to spend more with the likes of Harry Maguire linked with the exit door.
Here's the latest transfer news coming out of Old Trafford.

A deal has been struck for Lille star Yoro, who has flown in from France to undergo a medical after a £52million deal was struck. The stumbling block looked to be the player's desire to move to Real Madrid, who were also in the race to sign him.

Los Blancos were keen on waiting until he was available on a free, but Lille's agreement with United means that Yoro will now head to the north west of England to finalise personal terms, reports the Athletic. The Red Devils have the young centre-half on their shortlist and the French club were looking to sell with Yoro's contract winding down.

The Ligue 1 side had strongly favoured a deal with the Red Devils as they looked to cash in on their asset. United are hoping to secure a player in Yoro who is regarded across the game as being a generational talent.

The Red Devils will land 50 percent of any future transfer fee as part of Mason Greenwood's move to Marseille. The two clubs have agreed a £23.3million deal for Greenwood, who spent last season on loan at Spanish side Getafe and has a host of European clubs now eyeing him.

The forward last played for United two-and-a-half years ago before he was arrested and subsequently suspended by the club. Those at Old Trafford acknowledge they cannot allow Greenwood to play for the club again but want to maximise their profits.

They are conscious though of Greenwood maximising his talent and eventually become a world star, which would see his value skyrocket. United want to ensure they would be rewarded financially if the 22-year-old does move on to even bigger and better things.

United face the prospect of having Casemiro on their books for a third year as they struggle to source a buyer. The Brazilian's debut year saw him earn huge plaudits, but last term he endured a huge drop off and copped major criticism as the sums involved in signing him began to haunt them.
Despite his quality and a CV that includes a haul of Champions League successes whilst in Spain questions were asked when United signed a 30-year-old to a five-year deal on astronomical wages.

Now with Casemiro poised to turn 33 next season - and no longer a guaranteed starter - United have an expensive asset on their books which they can't rid off. The MEN reports that no Saudi Arabian interest has materialised, which some expected to be the case, and United may have to keep hold of the Brazilian.

headline: NBA icon Kevin Durant wastes no time picking between Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo
body: Phoenix Suns star Kevin Durant was asked who he prefers out of footballing greats Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo, with the two-time NBA champion barely giving his answer a thought
NBA legend Kevin Durant has weighed in on the Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo debate by declaring the Portuguese star as the "goat".

Durant, who now plays for Phoenix Suns after stints with Golden State Warriors and the Brooklyn Nets, was being interviewed by YouTuber Speed, and then later by Logan Paul & Mike Majlak on their podcast 'Impaulsive'. On both occasions when asked who he thought was better, the basketball icon took a slight pause before stating that Ronaldo was his preferred choice.

Discourse over who is the better player out of the two has been raging for years with pundits and fans alike often unable to seperate them. There was no such issue with Durant though with the two-time NBA champion, double MVP, and triple Olympic gold medalist knowing a thing or two about what it takes to make it as a sporting great.

The 30-year-old, who has also been selected for the All Star team 14 times in his storied career on the court, was approached by Speed, who pops the question about Ronaldo or Messi. Durant then takes a step back and ponders the query for a very brief moment before confidently stating it's Ronaldo he favours.

Speed then laughs before declaring that "KD is a Ronaldo fan" and that the former Oklahoma Thunder player "knows who the goat is". If you want to contextualise the argument over just who is the best ever between Ronaldo and Messi it's worth looking at the trophy hauls, both for team and individually, throughout their careers.

The Argentinian has won an astonishing eight Ballons d'Or compared to Ronaldo's five, eight of FIFA World's Best Player awards to Ronaldo's five, and six European Golden Shoes to Ronaldo's four, making him the most decorated player in the history of the game. Messi's unrivalled haul of 45 senior titles will seal the debate for most, and after he led Argentina to victory in the 2022 World Cup, a number of commentators and players have settled on Messi. But that's not the case according to Durant.

While Messi currently plays for Inter Miami, he spent the bulk of his professional career with Barcelona where he won 10 La Liga titles, seven Copa del Rey titles, and the Champions League four times. Ronaldo has played for several clubs throughout his career although trophies have often followed wherever he played his game.

His trophy cabinet, despite being slightly smaller than Messi's, is still nothing to be sniffed at with the Real Madrid and Manchester United legend winning 33 trophies in his career. This includes seven league titles, five Champions Leagues, Euro 2016 with Portugal and the UEFA Nations League.

headline: Gareth Southgate hires pal of Sir Jim Ratcliffe as new advisor after quitting England job
body: Gareth Southgate decided to leave his role with England after a hugely successful eight-year spell with the Three Lions and amid links with Manchester United has sought advice from a friend of Sir Jim Ratcliffe
Outgoing England boss Gareth Southgate has turned to Sir Jim Ratciffe ’s associate for help following his resignation.
Southgate announced earlier this week that he would be stepping down from his Three Lions role. The decision came after England’s Euro 2024 final defeat to Spain.

And in the aftermath of his exit, Southgate has sought advice from a close friend of Sir Jim Ratcliffe as he considers his next steps in management. According to The Sun, the 52-year-old has been working with Jimmy Worrall since splitting with his agent Terry Byrne.

Worrall is the founder and chairman of Leaders in Sport, a company who run worldwide networking events. He also acts as a consultant and has worked as an advisor for the likes of INEOS and the European Club Association.
Ex-England boss Southgate has known Worrall for years. He has decided to rely on his advice as opposed to employing a full-time agent following his split from former representative Byrne.
Worrall has already been involved in the talks that saw his spell as England boss come to an end. He could potentially play a huge role in his next career move.

There will naturally be links with Manchester United given Worrall’s previous work with INEOS. He also has a close relationship with Sir Dave Brailsford, who pushed for the appointment of Dan Ashworth at Old Trafford.
Southgate has been linked with the Red Devils in the past. Ratcliffe installed him as his favoured option should he have sacked Erik ten Hag.
In the end, United chose to shelve a move, with Ratcliffe sticking by current boss Ten Hag. He eventually signed a new contract with the Red Devils.
A fresh move for Southgate at this stage seems unlikely. United chiefs have already underlined their commitment to Ten Hag even if the club endures a tricky start to the new campaign.

headline: Man Utd fans call for Harry Maguire to return as captain after pre-season video emerges
body: Harry Maguire has been praised by Manchester United fans after a video emerged which showed him taking time to speak to all the academy players at the training ground
Manchester United fans have called on Erik ten Hag to reinstate Harry Maguire as captain after being reminded of his leadership skills in a behind-the-scenes video.

Maguire is one of few senior United players training at their Carrington complex after missing out on Euro 2024 due to injury. The 31-year-old defender was cut from Gareth Southgate’s squad after failing to shake off a calf injury and has been working hard to regain full fitness for the 2024/25 campaign with United.

He was not a part of the United squad which travelled to Trondheim to play Rosenborg on Monday and instead stayed behind to train alongside some of the club’s youngsters. And in a clip from MUTV, Maguire was shown saying hello to and shaking the hands of every player in the gym on training bikes.

Maguire goes along the line of academy players, who look delighted to get recognition from a senior player. The centre-back was stripped of the United captaincy by Erik ten Hag in July 2023, with the Dutchman opting to hand the armband to Bruno Fernandes, but he clearly still commands respect among the players.

The video clip went viral on Twitter, with many United fans posting praise for Maguire – with some suggesting he should replace Fernandes as skipper. “Acting like a leader,” one fan wrote. Another wrote: “That's my captain there”. “A captain’s attitude,” a third added.

Another wrote: “You always hear from many players in and around the squad how Maguire makes them feel welcoming and at home right away. This is a nice example of this in training this week greeting all the young lads. A class act and great leader.”

Maguire joined United in a £80million transfer from Leicester in the summer of 2019 and was made captain by Ole Gunnar Solskjaer in January 2020. Solskjaer revealed earlier this year that he had doubts about Fernandes’ suitability for the role.

“I knew Bruno Fernandes had captain qualities when I was manager at Manchester United,” he said on the Stick to Football podcast. “He’s got the personality and quality – but he knows and I’ve told him – that he’s too passionate at times and he loses a bit of control. I loved Harry Maguire as a captain, he was the leader in that group for me when I was at the club.”
He added: “The way that Harry Maguire has handled himself with everything happening to him at Manchester United is top class and just shows the character he’s got, that I want in players.”

Ten Hag is very unlikely to go back on his decision, especially given that Maguire is not guaranteed a place in the starting XI. United have spent £52m to bring in Leny Yoro, who could partner Lisandro Martinez in defence, while Matthijs de Ligt could also be arriving this summer.

headline: Man Utd reject transfer bid for Scott McTominay from Premier League rival
body: Scott McTominay managed to force himself back into Manchester United contention last season having looked set for an exit and the Red Devils have now shared their stance on a sale
Manchester United have turned down a bid from Fulham for academy graduate Scott McTominay.

The Red Devils midfielder has just a year remaining on his contract at Old Trafford - albeit United having an option to extend that deal by a further year. His precarious situation has left McTominay’s future far from certain.
And Premier League rivals have attempted to take advantage of that with a move. Fulham have reportedly tabled their opening bid for the Scottish midfielder.
But according to Mail Online, that offer has been rebuffed by the Red Devils. It is suggested that Fulham’s bid is lower than a £30m offer that Man United turned down from West Ham last summer.

McTominay looked set for an Old Trafford exit 12 months ago but enjoyed a dramatic u-turn under current boss Erik ten Hag. The 27-year-old scored a career-best 10 goals last term despite a tricky season from the Red Devils’ perspective.
Ten Hag regularly underlined how crucial McTominay had been. Speaking last season, the Dutchman said: “Every player has a price but he has a big value, sporting and also economic.

“I want to have a player like Scott McTominay in the squad. He is Manchester United in every faith. Every minute he will fight for the match. He is Manchester United in everything in his heart. When you are coming on and giving this to the team it tells a lot.”

"He is Manchester United in everything and in his heart,” the Red Devils’ boss added. ”So he's playing for the badge. He gives his life. And when you're coming on and you give this to the team, it tells a lot."

While Fulham are interested in a move for McTominay, foreign sides are also keeping a close eye on him. Galatasaray vice president Ibrahim Hatipoglu confirmed that his side had added the midfielder to their shortlist for the summer.
"McTominay's transfer fee is being discussed," he was quoted by Haber Sarı Kırmızı. "Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg is a good player, he has many suitors, he wants to see all options.

"There is no talk of single-digit figures for right-back and midfield transfers. But we have allocated a budget of less than €10million for right-back. There is no negative situation regarding Guela Doue [Rennes right-back]. Negotiations are ongoing [for] McTominay and Doue. Wan-Bissaka is not our priority."

headline: Jadon Sancho insider tells Man Utd that Erik ten Hag has ‘big problems’ with winger
body: Jadon Sancho has been welcomed back into the fold at Manchester United by Erik ten Hag, but the winger's former Borussia Dortmund manager foresees more problems
Erik ten Hag is to blame for the difficulties between him and Jadon Sancho – and they are likely to continue at Manchester United, according to Sancho’s former manager.

Sancho was exiled by Ten Hag after a public falling out and spent the second half of last season on loan at former club Borussia Dortmund. He enjoyed his time back in Germany, but has now returned to his parent club with Dortmund likely unable to afford to sign him permanently.

The winger has been handed a second chance by Ten Hag, who has allowed him to return to first-team training ahead of the 2024/25 campaign. The Dutchman has said they have “drawn the line” under the falling out and want to move on.

But Lucien Favre, who managed Sancho for two years during his first spell at Dortmund, has suggested that the ill-feeling between the two may linger – and that Ten Hag is to blame, given Sancho’s professionalism under his tutelage.

“Sancho is undoubtedly a top player. I remember when he continued working on the pitch after finishing training sessions at Borussia Dortmund,” Favre told Tuttosport. “He wanted to improve in everything. Shooting, passing, crosses. It was a pleasure to see him during those extra 20 minutes on the pitch.

“I’ve heard that there have been problems, big problems, between him and Ten Hag. When somebody like Sancho, with his strong commitment, arrives late for training sessions, it means that somebody is not working properly.”

Ten Hag and Sancho fell out after the Dutchman publicly called him out for poor displays in training. The Englishman responded on social media, denying the allegations while effectively accusing his boss of lying.

Sancho was banished from first-team training and hasn’t played a competitive match for his club since August 2023. He refused to back down and eventually found an exit route to Dortmund in January. But now back at United, he has attempted to mend his relationship with Ten Hag.
“As we said, we've drawn the line,” said Ten Hag, when asked about Sancho. “Manchester United needs good players and Jadon is a good player. We have drawn that line and we move on.”

Sancho was not a part of the United squad which lost 1-0 to Rosenberg on Monday, but will be involved in the upcoming friendlies against Rangers, Arsenal, Real Betis and Liverpool on their pre-season tour before the Community Shield against Manchester City next month. The 24-year-old is understood to have wanted to stay with Dortmund, but he still has two years left on his United contract, which pays around £290,000-a-week, making a transfer difficult.

headline: Leny Yoro transfer has immediate knock-on effect for Man Utd signing Jarrad Branthwaite
body: Manchester United saw two bids rejected by Everton for Jarrad Branthwaite earlier this summer and the £52m signing of Leny Yoro will complicate negotiations further
Manchester United appear to have sacrificed their chances of landing Everton star Jarrad Branthwaite by splashing the cash to sign Leny Yoro.

United have committed to signing Yoro from Lille for an initial fee of £52million, which could rise as high as £62m with add-ons. The 18-year-old Frenchman is poised to sign a five-year contract with United after flying in to finalise terms and complete a medical on Wednesday.

The agreement comes as a surprise, with many in the industry, including Liverpool, believing that Real Madrid were in pole position to sign Yoro. He is set to become the second summer signing for United after striker Joshua Zirkzee, who cost £36.5m from Bologna.

The need for central defenders was clear for United this summer after Raphael Varane was released at the end of his contract. The club have since sold Willy Kambwala to Villarreal and are open to offers for Victor Lindelof, increasing the need for reinforcements in the position.

However, it seems United have burned their bridges with Everton over the potential addition of Branthwaite. Manchester Evening News reports that the Toffees have been emboldened in their stance on Branthwaite, having previously rejected two offers from United for the defender.

United saw bids worth £43m and £50m rejected earlier this summer, with Everton insisting they value the 21-year-old at a minimum of £70m. Having seen United spend £52m on an 18-year-old who has no Premier League or international experience, they are convinced they have taken the right approach in negotiations over Branthwaite.

Erik ten Hag’s side had tried to play hard ball in talks over the centre-back, insisting they only had a limited transfer budget due to profit and sustainability considerations. Yet United have since committed to spending a combined £88.5m to sign Zirkzee and Yoro to undermine their negotiating position.

Everton are selling Amadou Onana to Aston Villa for £50m and are therefore under no financial pressure to also let go of Branthwaite, who impressed last season alongside James Tarkowski. United have previously annoyed Everton by submitting a joint £28m offer for Leighton Baines and Marouane Fellaini in 2013 and will likely have to look elsewhere if they want another centre-back this summer.

United have been in talks with Bayern Munich over signing Matthijs de Ligt, but that deal has already potentially been complicated by Yoro’s arrival. Mirror Football understands that Ten Hag has told De Ligt that he wants him to play alongside Lisandro Martinez – a promise he might have to break now Yoro is on the scene.

Ten Hag has been able to boost his transfer budget by allowing Varane and Anthony Martial to leave on free transfers, while selling Kambwala, Donny van de Beek and Alvaro Fernandez. The club are hoping to net a further £30m for Mason Greenwood, which can be reinvested in new players.

headline: Man Utd's next steps in Erik ten Hag transfer plan after huge Leny Yoro boost
body: Manchester United will need to sell players to continue their foray into the transfer market, with Lille defender Leny Yoro jetting in for a medical with the Red Devils
The signing of Leny Yoro will not end Manchester United's hopes of landing another central defender.

Manchester United are set to secure their second transfer of the summer, with the Lille defender set to undergo a medical at Old Trafford. The 18-year-old will command a £52million fee, with the Red Devils now holding the advantage after the Frenchman had been expected to join Real Madrid.

United are said to have a limited budget of £50million this summer and have already signed Dutch forward Joshua Zirkzee for £36.5m from Bologna. The club agreed a deal to implement a more favourable release clause.

With players to depart the 13-time Premier League champions including Mason Greenwood, Erik ten Hag could also see more stars added to his squad. United still have ambitions to land another central defender, with the position having been a priority for the club in the transfer market.

Heading into the summer, the club planned to strengthen in the centre of defence, midfield and up front. United still intend to add another defender should they be able to raise funds through sales, according to the Daily Mail.

The club continue to target Everton's Jarrod Branthwaite and Bayern Munich defender Matthijs de Ligt. Sporting director Dan Ashworth has seen the Toffees reject bids for Branthwaite, with a £45m offer dismissed.
Everton are hopeful of nearer £70m for the 22-year-old. And the figure United are set to spend on Yoro could strengthen the resolve of Sean Dyche's side.

Ten Hag is more familiar with De Ligt who he coached while at Ajax. It is understood United's boss has already held direct talks with his countryman, with reports suggesting personal terms are already agreed.
German giants Bayern are said to want £42m for the 24-year-old they signed in a deal that could rise to £68m from Juventus.
Speaking last month Ten Hag explained the transfers that would help United progress. The 54-year-old wants to see his side bounce back from eighth place in the Premier League.
"We need to get a striker in to work alongside Rasmus Hojlund," he said. "I also hope we manage to get another central midfielder and also a replacement for Varane.

"Then I think things will look very good for next season - with the caveat that the players are fit and stay fit. Then you can start playing towards the top four with such an eleven. That gives me hope and is also realistic in my eyes."

headline: Unrecognisable ex-Man Utd star 'left bloodied by attack' after Euro 2024 final
body: Former Manchester United star Andrei Kanchelskis was in a Moscow bar watching the Euro 2024 final between England and Spain when he was involved in a violent altercation
Ex-Man Utd star Andrei Kanchelskis has been left with a gruesome eye injury after allegedly being attacked in a bar.
The two-time Premier League champion was watching the Euro 2024 final between England and Spain in a Moscow bar. But his evening took a shocking turn after he was involved in a violent incident.
Reports have suggested he was attacked after exchanging insults with a fellow reveller. Punches were then thrown, leaving Kanchelskis, 55, needing first aid from staff.
An ambulance was called but the former forward did not need a hospital trip. He has since shared a few updates on his condition - including a gruesome selfie showing his swollen and bruised eye.

Speaking to Russian outlet SE about the attack, Kanchelskis said: "I’m fine now. A small conflict, we clashed over interests after the final match of the Euros. I want to note that the conflict did not happen because of the football match - but a personal matter.
"I wrote a statement to the police about my offender. What will happen next I don’t want to advertise it. A trial is possible, and I will wait for the decision. We will do everything within the law.”

Kanchelskis spent four years at Old Trafford under Sir Alex Ferguson after arriving from Shakhtar Donetsk. He scored 36 goals across 161 appearances, winning two Premier League titles, the League Cup and the FA Cup.
He was sold to Everton and went on to play for rivals Man City, Rangers and Fiorentina. But the Red Devils always held a special place in his heart.
Where will Man Utd finish in the Premier League this season? Share your predictions in the comments below
Speaking to MailOnline, Kanchelskis said: “I love Manchester United. In my heart it’s still the best club in Europe. Maybe I will come to the new Everton stadium in August, it depends on my future.
“Of course, I will go to Old Trafford and visit Sir Alex. I will bring him a present of black caviar, because he loves it.”

He has been left furious at the problems the Red Devils have faced over recent seasons. Analysing their struggles, Kanchelskis added: “When I played for United, the dressing-room, the players were held together, but I don’t understand what’s happening at Manchester United now. I think there are some problems somewhere.
“If you see in the past, everybody was working for these titles: the people cleaning the kitchen, the director, the secretary, the players, the kit man.
"First of all Man Utd, it’s a big club and like a family. Some people playing for Man United now don’t remember what happened. There’s no family now, in my opinion.”

headline: Leny Yoro's contract details emerge as Man Utd move swiftly to complete £52m transfer
body: Manchester United are on the verge of sealing their second transfer of the summer with Leny Yoro set to complete his medical to reinforce Erik ten Hag's defence at Old Trafford
Leny Yoro is set to sign a five-year deal with Manchester United should he pass his medical.

United have agreed a £52million fee with Lille that could rise as high as £59m with add-ons. The agreement was made last week before the 18-year-old defender decided to make the move on Tuesday evening.
Yoro has arrived in the North West to finalise terms and undergo a medical. A one-year option to extend his contract by 12 months will be in place as part of the five-year deal he is set to sign.

The Frenchman is set to become Erik ten Hag's second signing of the summer after the Red Devils secured the signing of Joshua Zirkzee for £36.5m from Bologna. Real Madrid had led the race for the ace who has drawn comparisons to Virgil van Dijk.

Los Blancos have so far appeared unwilling to meet the fee that Manchester United have offered. Lille prefer to make a deal this summer rather than lose him on a free next summer after his contract expires.

Liverpool and Paris Saint-Germain have also been reported to be interested in the teenager but Real were the long-time favourites. United have taken advantage of a deal not being done to pounce however.

United have not ended their hopes of adding another defender to their backline but will be required to sell players before doing so. The club have seen bids rejected for Jarrod Branthwaite already this summer.

The 13-time Premier League champion's move for Yoro could ensure a deal for the 22-year-old continues to prove difficult. The Toffees are said to have been emboldened in their stance after knocking back deals worth £43m and £50m.

Sean Dyche's side are said to want nearer £70m for their defender who still has a contract until 2027. Everton have previously highlighted the fees spent on Harry Maguire, Wesley Fofana and Josko Gvardiol in recent years, which are all £75m or above.

The Goodison Park side are also now under less pressure to sell with the club on the bring of selling Amadou Onana to Aston Villa for £50m. Onana joined Everton from Lille in 2022 for £30m and made 37 appearances in all competitions for the club.
Villa are looking to strengthen their midfield as they embark on a Champions League campaign. Unai Emery's side have already seen Douglas Luiz depart for Juventus and have signed Ross Barkley.

headline: Why Liverpool pulled out of Leny Yoro transfer race as fans fume at £52m Man Utd move
body: Leny Yoro is having a medical before completing switch to Manchester United - and Liverpool's apparent reason for withdrawing the interest has left supporters raging
Manchester United have pipped Liverpool to the signing of Leny Yoro - in part because the Merseyside club thought the centre-back was only interested in joining Real Madrid.

But after the La Liga champions decided against moving this summer, having already put resources into bringing in France superstar Kylian Mbappe, United have snuck in to complete a deal worth up to £52m with Lille. It's understood Liverpool were under the impression that Madrid were favourites - and decided against stepping up their interest this summer.

Yoro, 18, will have his medical on Tuesday before finalising personal terms - and he will become the second signing of the summer at United, following the acquisition of Netherlands forward Joshua Zirkzee from Bologna.

He is expected to sign a five-year deal, while United remain interested in another Dutch player, Bayern Munich ’s Matthijs de Ligt, and have had two bids - the most recent of which was £45m - rejected by Everton for up-and-coming England international Jarrad Branthwaite.

Centre back has been earmarked as the area needing the greatest overhaul by head coach Erik ten Hag. Raphael Varane left the club at the end of last season, while they are open to offers for Harry Maguire and Victor Lindelof.

After Zirkzee's arrival was confirmed on Sunday, Ten Hag said: "He is a player who can link up the game, who can be available, hold up the ball, have good ideas, be creative, can dribble, [make] combinations.

"So that's a different type and always what we are looking for, so it gives us more options tactically, which is good because, especially up front, we have many players who can play very direct and they can take a big benefit from his skills."

However the Yoro deal has appeared to catch Liverpool ’s recruitment department and owners FSG out, leading to a predictably furious response from some of their supporters online. "FSG have been found out yet again," one fan posted on X. Another added: "Liverpool are far too big for FSG."

And one fan went further by questioning the club’s entire strategy, writing: "We didn't bid for Yoro because we have no money, plain and simple, as we haven't sold anyone yet. Sell to buy merchants. FSG run Liverpool like Bournemouth."

New boss Arne Slot is yet to see an addition made to his squad, although leading goalscorer Mo Salah is expected to stay despite interest from clubs in Saudi Arabia. The club also have no interest in selling Trent Alexander-Arnold despite the England star entering the final year of his contract.

headline: Leny Yoro faces same issue at Man Utd that saw Mikel Arteta fall out with William Saliba
body: As Manchester United look to have secured the signature of another talented young player, it appears he may endure a similar issue to William Saliba
Leny Yoro may need to follow a similar path to William Saliba if he is to become a success at Manchester United.

Yoro, 18, is one of the most sought-after central defenders in world football, having also been pursued by Real Madrid and Paris Saint Germain. But the Lille teenager is set to join Erik ten Hag's side and has flown into the red side of Manchester for a medical.

This has pleased many United fans, including club legend Rio Ferdinand, who recently told the United hierarchy to sign the centre-back during a recent podcast appearance. Yoro is not the first young French defender to sign for a Premier League club with a huge reputation.

In the summer of 2019, before Mikel Arteta even became the manager of Arsenal, the Gunners signed a then 18-year-old Saliba from Saint Etienne for £27million. He would not make his Premier League debut until 2022 when Arteta was finally convinced he was ready. Yoro may have to be similarly patient at Old Trafford.

After signing, Saliba was immediately loaned back to Saint Etienne by the Gunners. He would then be sent on loan to Nice and Marseille before he was finally integrated into the first team. When his first loan came to an end, it looked like he might not have a future in North London, as he was left out of Arsenal's Europa League squad.

When he was loaned to Nice, a furious Saliba told French media: "The coach immediately told me that I was not ready. I would have at least liked to have had a chance to rediscover my rhythm. But this is football, it's like that."

He also added: "He judged me on two-and-a-half matches. I would have liked for him to play me more. But he told me I wasn't ready. I was waiting for him to give me a chance, but football is like that.

"When I initially came to Arsenal the league looked very good so I showed up to training and wanted to train on my own to show the coach I was ready. I am happy now, I want to play for Nice. The idea when you're part of a team is a better feeling for me."

In his first week back at Arsenal after returning from Marseille, Arteta completely gave him the cold shoulder. Saliba addressed this in an interview with the Daily Mail last year when he said: "I was so excited to do a pre-season with the team and to try to play in the Premier League and the Europa League.

"He said hello to me the first day, and then after he didn't speak with me." The French international added: "I told myself to be good on the pitch, to give him a solution, to tell him: 'Yeah I'm ready'. To tell him on the pitch is the better way… I knew one day he'd come to speak to me."

Saliba is now one of the first names on every Arsenal team-sheet. Saliba has also managed to change the mind of France manager Didier Deschamps. The World Cup-winning manager was not convinced by Saliba at first, but the central defender went on to play every minute of France's Euro 2024 campaign, which saw them reach the semi-final.

At present, it is currently unclear what United plan to do with Yoro. The centre of defence has appeared to be a priority area for United, having already lost Raphael Varane, whose contract expired at the end of June.

They have also been linked with a move for Bayern Munich defender Matthijs de Ligt, who starred under Ten Hag at Ajax. United also still have Harry Maguire, Lisandro Martinez and Victor Lindelof within their defensive ranks.

headline: Supercomputer predicts Premier League 2024/25 season including winner and relegation
body: The new Premier League season is just one month away, and a number of Manchester City's rivals will be looking to prevent Pep Guardiola's side claiming a fifth straight title
Manchester City will go into the 2024-25 Premier League season chasing a fifth successive title, and predictions from a supercomputer have backed them to do just that.

Pep Guardiola's side were run close last season. Liverpool topped the table at the start of April before falling away, while Arsenal were still in with a chance of top spot going into the final round of fixtures.

There has been plenty of change over the summer, with several clubs appointing new managers. Among them are Liverpool and Chelsea, who are both chasing improved performances after bringing in Arne Slot and Enzo Maresca respectively.

Last season saw all three promoted sides drop straight back down to the Championship, but Leicester, Ipswich and Southampton are all hoping to avoid a repeat. And, according to Grosvenor Sport's supercomputer, two of them will stay up by the skin of their teeth.

The supercomputer, essentially a probability model, simulates each Premier League game 1,000 times over to predict results for each game. With those results, based on factors including team strength and betting markets and incorporating an element of randomness, a final table is generated.

It gives Manchester City a huge 90 percent chance of the title at this stage, though it acknowledges predictions can change as teams sign new players and other factors change. Last season's runners-up Arsenal are second favourites, after finishing two points adrift last term.

The final table has City in top spot with 94 points, three points more than last season. It places Arsenal second, with three points fewer than last term, leaving the gap at eight, with Liverpool third above Manchester United despite Erik ten Hag's side winning the league in more simulations than Arne Slot's men.

At the other end of the table, the supercomputer believes Ipswich Town will finish bottom. The Tractor Boys, who finished second in the Championship last season, have retained the services of manager Kieran McKenna despite reports of Chelsea interest but are being backed to struggle.

The other relegation spots, however, are filled by teams who played Premier League football last season. Wolves are predicted to finish 19th with 29 points - 11 more than Ipswich - with Nottingham Forest in 18th.

Forest's predicted tally of 32 points is just two fewer than the 34 predicted for Leicester, who have Forest's former manager Steve Cooper in the dugout. Just one point above the Foxes sit Southampton and Brighton, who the supercomputer is tipping to fall away after the departure of manager Roberto De Zerbi.

The upcoming season could yet be Pep Guardiola's last at the Etihad Stadium. The Catalan is among those being considered to succeed Gareth Southgate as England manager, with suggestions an interim candidate could take charge of the national side until the end of the domestic season.
"A national team," Guardiola told ESPN in February when asked what he had left to achieve. "I would like to train a national team for a World Cup or a European Championship. I would like that.

"I would like to have the experience of living through a World Cup, or a Euro or a Copa America, or whatever it is. I would like that. I don't know when that would be, if that is five, 10, 15 years from now but I would like to have the experience of being a manager in a World Cup."

Guardiola's City have averaged 89.75 points per season over the last four campaigns, winning the title each time. If the supercomputer proves correct, they'll lift that average above 90 with another first-place finish this term.
Premier League 2024-25 table (according to Grosvenor Sport's supercomputer):
1. Manchester City - 94 points
2. Arsenal - 86
3. Liverpool - 80
4. Manchester United - 71
5. Chelsea - 67
6. Aston Villa - 65
7. Tottenham - 63
8. West Ham - 57
9. Newcastle - 57
10. Brentford - 57
11. Crystal Palace - 47
12. Bournemouth - 46
13. Everton - 42
14. Fulham - 42
15. Brighton - 35
16. Southampton - 35
17. Leicester - 34
18. Nottingham Forest - 32
19. Wolves - 29
20. Ipswich - 18

headline: Teddy Sheringham reacts to awkward Roy Keane clip admitting he didn't like him at Man Utd
body: Manchester United legends Teddy Sheringham and Roy Keane did not see eye to eye during their time as team-mates, with the latter admitting he never liked the former England striker
Teddy Sheringham has been hailed by Roy Keane as the finest captain he's ever played under, despite their infamous scuffle at Manchester United.
The pair were team-mates for four trophy-laden years at the Red Devils, clinching three Premier League titles and completing an historic Treble in the 1998/99 season.

Their time together was marked by success on the pitch, but off it they weren't exactly the best of friends, with Keane openly admitting his dislike for Sheringham, a revelation that came to light during an exchange with Gary Neville on The Overlap, reports the Manchester Evening News.

In a viral social media snippet, Neville, brandishing a photo of Sheringham, teased Keane with hints about the mystery man's identity as the ex-United captain joked: "You didn't like him... that could be anybody. Jeez, I've got a list" leading Keane to correctly guess: "No, you shouldn't say I didn't like him... Jordi [Cruyff]? Or Teddy?"
The Irishman later sought to clarify the nature of their relationship, stating: "That's wrong. I didn't mind Teddy, I just didn't get on with him. We had a fallout but that's just working".

In an interview with Online Poker, the Englishman spoke highly of his former team-mate despite a rather heated past as he said: "I always respected Roy, he was our captain and our leader and was one of the best players I ever played with. I loved having him in my football teams I played with him at Nottingham Forest as well as Manchester United and there was no better leader in football that I'd played for.
"Players within big squads will always have differences in opinions, but in terms of what he did on the pitch in the years that I played with him, he was the best captain that I ever played under."

Sheringham previously opened up about the tense fall-out he had with Keane, which is detailed in the book '1999: Manchester United, the Treble and All That', during which they didn't exchange a word for three-and-a-half-years after a fierce spat.

"I'm sitting behind the driver, Keany was next to the driver," he explained in the book. "Steve Bruce is next to me, [Gary] Pallister, Denis [Irwin], a couple of others in there. Bit of banter flying about in the car. Suddenly, Keany said: 'Why don't you f*** off back to London in your f***ing red Ferrari and your penthouse?
"I was taken aback and asked: 'Eh? '; and he insists: 'Yeah, f*** off back to London'. I was stunned and said: 'Are you coming for me, Keany? Why are you coming for me. What the hell?!'"

"And he went: 'f*** off', and he goes on: 'f***ing red Ferrari, penthouse...' Then he jumped round, still with his bad leg, got me by the tie, pulled me towards him, grappling with him. Suddenly everyone's going: 'What's going on? ' and pulling us apart."

headline: Sir Jim Ratcliffe's blocked Man Utd transfer allows Premier League rival to agree deal
body: West Ham have struck a deal to sign Nice centre-back Jean-Clair Todibo, who had previously been wanted by Manchester United before the Red Devils were blocked from landing the Frenchman by UEFA

West Ham have agreed a deal with Nice to sign highly-rated central defender Jean-Clair Todibo, though their chances of completing the transfer are understood to be doubtful. The agreement that has been struck is an initial loan with the inclusion of a £26.85million (€32m) buy-option that would hand the Hammers the chance to make the move permanent next summer.  However, there is still work to do on personal terms as Juventus remain in the race and sources suggest the 24-year-old would favour a transfer to Turin over east London meaning his arrival at the London Stadium is by no means a formality. Nice are understood to be pushing the player to join the Irons as Juventus are yet to table an acceptable offer for the former Manchester United target.

United were recently blocked by UEFA from signing Todibo under their multi-club ownership rules after both teams were cleared to compete in next season's Europa League.  He had previously been high on their transfer agenda but could now end up lining up against United for the Hammers, providing they're able to get the ambitious swoop over the line. West Ham have refused to give up on their target after seeing at least one offer rejected by Nice earlier in the window. Sources close to Nice also claim West Ham floated fellow centre-backs Kurt Zouma and Nayef Aguerd to the Ligue 1 side during negotiations.  Todobi recently told The Daily Mail that he was open to testing himself in the Premier League, stating: "It's nice to hear all the compliments. I'm trying to stay focused on my game and my team-mates - but for sure I am open to playing in the Premier League."

Julen Lopetegui's side have already landed Wolves captain Max Kilman in a £40m deal having also signed Brazilian attacking talent Luis Guilherme from Palmeiras for £25.5m.  But their window is evidently far from done with attacking reinforcements also in the offing for technical director Tim Steidten. In the past few days, the Hammers have generated further cash to spend following the £18m sale of midfielder Flynn Downes to Southampton.  Downes had been part of West Ham's pre-season training camp in Austria before being given permission to seal a permanent switch to St Mary's, where he spent last season on loan. His former employers Ipswich Town had also shown a strong interest.  A striker remains top of Lopetegui's to-do list with Aston Villa's Jhon Duran among the key names of interest. There is nothing currently in links to Villarreal's Alexander Sorloth, however, despite rumours of a bid for the Norwegian.

headline: Mason Greenwood transfer: Man Utd's mammoth sell-on clause revealed as transfer agreed
body: Mason Greenwood is closing in on a permanent transfer move to Marseille after Manchester United decided to cash in on the forward, who hasn't played for the Red Devils since January 2022
Manchester United will land 50 per cent of any future transfer fee as part of Mason Greenwood's move to Marseille.

Both clubs have agreed an initial £23.3million deal for Greenwood, who spent last season on loan at Spanish side Getafe. The forward, 22, last played for United two-and-a-half years ago before he was arrested and subsequently suspended by the club.

In February 2023, Greenwood had charges of attempted rape, engaging in controlling and coercive behaviour, and assault occasioning actual bodily harm - all of which he denied - dropped by the Crown Prosecution Service. Following a six-month internal investigation and fierce backlash over his potential return, United decided that it was best for the one-time England international to continue his career away from Old Trafford.

His loan spell with Getafe was a success, registering 10 goals and six assists over 36 appearances, mostly coming from the right-hand side of midfield. Greenwood's form piqued the interest of clubs across Europe but after keen interest from Lazio, it is French side Marseille who have reached an agreement with United and are set to win the race.

The total fee could rise to £26.7m if certain add-ons - relating to personal and team success - are activated. But United have also secured a deal which entitles them to 50 per cent of whatever fee Marseille receive should they sell Greenwood in the future.

Marseille have been criticised for moving for Greenwood, but boss Roberto De Zerbi recently expressed his admiration for the 22-year-old's talents, saying in a press conference: "He is a champion, an international-level player. I don't know his past, I don't know exactly what happened. I don't like to interfere in the private lives of players.

"The only thing I can say is that when a player signs for the club where I work, I consider him as my child. I protect him through thick and thin, even if I can pull his ear in private, I will defend him publicly. My players are like my sons."

Marseille's club president, Pablo Longoria, also defended the move, saying: "For a year-and-a-half we have put in place a social program among the strongest in Europe and it was a personal idea that Marseille would be invested in all the subjects where football has a place – in education, in women’s football, the work of the foundation.
"What is certain is that no matter which player comes to Marseille, he must share our values and the ones we want to have in common with society.
"At Marseille, there is no religion, no social class, we want Marseille to be a vector of social unity and for all players to share this vision. We want people with values and good people."

headline: Alejandro Garnacho sends six-word message to Lionel Messi after injury left him in tears
body: After Argentina captain Lionel Messi limped off in the Copa America final versus Colombia, Manchester United ace Alejandro Garnacho paid tribute to his international skipper
Manchester United starlet Alejandro Garnacho expressed his gratitude towards international captain Lionel Messi after the legendary Argentina captain won back-to-back Copa America triumphs.

The Inter Miami forward played 64 minutes of the final versus Colombia as La Albiceleste prevailed to lift the trophy at Hard Rock Stadium. Having left the field through injury, the team's talisman was left sobbing on the bench. But his sorrow quickly evaporated as his teammates finished the job with a 1-0 win.

This is the third major tournament in a row where Argentina have reigned victorious as the current crop of players under Lionel Scaloni continues to make history. Following another glorious night for the country, Garnacho was among those to pay tribute to his skipper for his contributions to the triumph.

The Old Trafford ace was an unused substitute in the showpiece, having only featured for 66 minutes across the competition in the United States. Taking to Instagram, the 20-year-old spoke glowingly about Messi as he took to the replies after a post from the eight-time Ballon d'Or winner to remark: "Thank you for so much captain."

As for the Argentina talisman, his pride was clear as he looked back over another successful tournament, saying: "Copa America is over and the first thing I want to thank everyone for the messages and greetings. I'm doing well, thank God, and hopefully soon I can be on the court again enjoying what I love doing most.

"I'm happy, a lot, especially because we achieved the goal we had and Fide leaves us but with another Cup. The biggest ones, like him, Ota or me, we live it with special excitement, with other teammates who already have several tournaments and add their experience as well, and with a litter of young people who give their all in every ball."

Paying tribute to his teammates, Messi appeared convinced that the best is yet to come for this Argentina team, as he added: "We are a team and also a family, a spectacular group. Thanks to everyone who was supporting us, this national team has a lot of present and a lot of future too. Let's go Argentina."

Team head coach Scaloni also purred about his players' efforts stateside, asserting: "In the second half I think we improved and deserved to win and then always in extra time, in the long run the team always finds something extra, so it's gratifying to see them play and I'm eternally grateful for the way they give their all,"

With Messi potentially facing a spell on the sidelines after an ankle injury in the final, Inter Miami confirmed: "After a medical evaluation, it has been determined that Leo Messi has suffered a ligament injury in his right ankle. The captain's availability will be determined by periodic assessments and the progress of his recovery."

headline: Teddy Sheringham responds to viral clip of ex-Man Utd skipper Roy Keane
body: Roy Keane was accused of not liking Teddy Sheringham during an interview with Gary Neville but the former Manchester United striker has outlined his view on the Irishman
Teddy Sheringham insists he "always respected" Roy Keane after the Irishman was accused of not liking the ex-Manchester United striker in a video.

The two men played together at Old Trafford and at Nottingham Forest for a period. Both were part of the 1999 treble winning side with Sheringham bagging United's equaliser during their iconic Champions League victory over Bayern Munich at the Camp Nou.

Keane was the skipper of that side and was renowned for keeping standards high. His confrontational nature saw him clash with some of his team-mates but Gary Neville claimed, during a game of guess the team-mates, that he and Sheringham didn't get on.

In an attempt to offer a clue Neville told Keane: "You didn't like him... that could be anybody. Jeez, I've got a list!" That prompted former United captain Keane to uncomfortably guess: "No, you shouldn't say I didn't like him... Jordi [Cruyff]? Or Teddy?"
Keane followed it up by offering an explanation as he said: "That's wrong. I didn't mind Teddy," before adding: "I just didn't get on with him. We had a fallout but that's just working."
Sheringham confessed that they did have "differences in opinions" but hailed the impact the Irishman had on the pitch and labelled him as the best captain he played alongside.

He told Online Poker : “I always respected Roy. He was our captain and our leader and was one of the best players I ever played with. I loved having him in my football teams – I played with him at Nottingham Forest as well as Manchester United and there was no better leader in football that I’d played for.
“Players within big squads will always have differences in opinions, but in terms of what he did on the pitch in the years that I played with him, he was the best captain that I ever played under.”
Sheringham has also previously admitted to a feud with Andy Cole, one of his frontman partners, with the pair getting off on the wrong foot and struggling to build bridges from there.

"We didn't have the best relationship," he said. "I think we rubbed each other up wrongly from the first moment we met and it didn't get any better to be honest. But we were both very professional in what we did and we wanted to get the best for Manchester United. That was the way we both focused on what we did. It was probably a personality clash."

headline: Leny Yoro makes U-turn as Manchester United get huge transfer breakthrough
body: Manchester United look to be closing in on a deal for Leny Yoro with the Lille youngster heading in to discuss personal terms despite originally wanting a move to Real Madrid
Manchester United target Leny Yoro is jetting in from Lille to undergo a medical after a £52million deal was struck.

The Red Devils have the young centre-half on their shortlist and the French club were looking to sell with Yoro's contract winding down. The stumbling block looked to be the player's desire to move to Real Madrid, who were also in the race to sign him.

Los Blancos were keen on waiting until he was available on a free, but Lille's agreement with United means that Yoro will now head to the north west of England to finalise personal terms as the Premier League club look to land another signing, reports the Athletic.

The Ligue 1 side had strongly favoured a deal with the Red Devils as they looked to cash in on their asset. United are hoping to secure a player in Yoro who is regarded across the game as being a generational talent.

Lille were not prepared to sell to a Ligue 1 rival, which ruled out a move to PSG despite their effort to lure Yoro to the French capital in January. Liverpool are also understood to retain an interest but were not in advanced negotiations for the defender.

Erik ten Hag is looking to bolster his defensive options and is also eyeing Matthijs de Ligt and Jarrad Branthwaite alongside Yoro. The club will not sign all three and much may depend on which deal they can get over the line first. A fee with Bayern Munich has reportedly been agreed for De Ligt.

Everton meanwhile have stood firm on their valuation of Branthwaite - already rejecting several bids from the Manchester outfit. The young English defender is open to a switch but the Toffees will not sell for less than their hefty valuation.

United have already completed one signing in what is the first window overseen by their new INEOS owners. Joshua Zirkzee has been bought in from Bologna for just under £40m after the Dutch forward impressed in Serie A last term.

It is possible that one or both of Victor Lindelof and Harry Maguire may have to be sold to finance the club's summer business. United have raised capital thanks to the sales of several players with Donny van de Beek heading to Girona and Willy Kambwala moving to Villarreal.

headline: Leny Yoro team-mate breaks ranks to approve Man Utd transfer in glowing endorsement
body: Angel Gomes left Manchester United for Lille and has been playing with defender Leny Yoro, who the Red Devils are hoping to sign this summer after striking a transfer agreement
Lille's Angel Gomes has backed Leny Yoro to be a huge success at Manchester United as he closes on a switch to Old Trafford.

The Red Devils have reached an agreement with the Ligue 1 outfit to sign Yoro for £52million. Yoro, 18, is flying to Manchester and looking to finalise personal terms after deciding not to wait on a dream move to Real Madrid - who had been unwilling to meet the French club's asking price.

And Yoro has received a glowing endorsement from team-mate Gomes, who left United in June 2020. He has been rubbing shoulders with the youngster since and was blown away by how he seamlessly slotted into the first-team environment at Lille despite his tender age.

He previously told Eurosport “As soon as he arrived in the group, I understood that he was going to reach the summits. When I discovered the pros at the age of 16 at Manchester United, I understood that it was different. He already had the right temperament.
“That’s not normal for a 16- or 17-year-old player arriving. It’s like he’s already an experienced player and it showed in the way he trained, the way he behaved. His progress was obvious.”

Bringing in young talent has its risks, especially if they are thrown into a pressurised environment with a lack of senior pros to lean on. United though have been able to benefit from trusting youth, seeing the likes of Kobbie Mainoo and Alejandro Garnacho step up.

United are looking to bolster their defensive options having seen their backline struggle last term. Yoro, Matthijs de Ligt and Jarrad Branthwaite are all on their radar with Erik ten Hag keen to land two of the three men on his shortlist - although getting a second may depend on the futures of Victor Lindelof and Harry Maguire, and whether one of those can be shifted.

Lille president Olivier Letang has already made it clear that Yoro will be sold this summer. Spanish giants Madrid had been Yoro's preferred destination, but United's charm offensive has seen him come around to the idea of moving immediately - something his club, unsurprisingly, also prefer.
United's new top brass view Yoro as a player who could shine at the centre of defence for the next decade.

headline: Gary Neville tips Gareth Southgate for new job after Man Utd perform Erik ten Hag U-turnVIDEO
body: Gareth Southgate is out of work after stepping down as England manager, causing a potential headache for Manchester United after they previously made him their No.1 target to replace Erik ten Hag
Gary Neville has backed Gareth Southgate to find a new job in international football after quitting his role as England manager.

Southgate, 53, brought his eight-year tenure with the Three Lions to an end on Tuesday, announcing that he's resigned ahead of his contract expiring this December. His England side endured yet more heartache last Sunday by losing the Euro 2024 final 2-1 to Spain, extending their wait for a trophy to at least 60 years.

It was only a matter of months ago that Manchester United made Southgate their No.1 candidate to replace Erik ten Hag, who at the time was on thin ice at Old Trafford. Even after ending the season with a superb FA Cup final victory over Manchester City, United chiefs including Sir Jim Ratcliffe and Sir Dave Brailsford met with other managerial targets while first-choice pick Southgate was preparing for this summer's European Championship.

Ratcliffe and Brailsford eventually decided to keep Ten Hag and recently triggered a one-year extension clause in his contract, but doubts remain over his long-term future. With Southgate now out of work, United could be facing a conundrum.

Neville, however, sees his former England team-mate staying in the international game as opposed to returning to club football after a 15-year absence since being sacked by Middlesbrough. "I would like to think Gareth will stay in international management," the United legend told Sky Sports.

"His patience and understanding is second to none and it suits him. He is a statesman-like leader who represents countries really well. He is such a proud Englishman - he doesn't look like a bulldog type who will fight for his country, like Terry Butcher and Stuart Pearce, but he is that type in a different shell.
Your turn! Should Manchester United ditch Erik ten Hag for Gareth Southgate? Let us know in the comments section
"But I think he could take his learnings into another country. He could also stay with England and the FA in a higher role and develop English coaches."

Following Neville's comments, a report from the Daily Mail claimed that United are 'highly unlikely' to renew their interest in Southgate. The 53-year-old has already been tipped to manage the USA while he could succeed Eddie Howe at Newcastle if the current Magpies boss gets the England job.

Neville would be happy to see Howe given the role, and the same goes for ex-Brighton and Chelsea boss Graham Potter. "There is no science in terms of what works and there are obvious contenders," Neville added.

"Graham Potter and Eddie Howe will get mentioned and I think it will definitely be an English manager. Moving to St. George's Park was to promote and develop English coaches. To take that away from an English manager and give to an international manager would be wrong."
