headline: Erik ten Hag sounding like Jose Mourinho in pre-season is good for Manchester United
body: 'Good is not good enough' was Erik ten Hag's maxim in his first season at Man United. It wasn't last season but he is sounding like his old self.
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Fear and loathing in Los Angeles? Manchester United return to UCLA next week six years on from the tour de farce that signalled the beginning of the end for Jose Mourinho.

Mourinho was in a lugubrious mood but deprived of support. Rui Faria was no longer by his side, Ed Woodward was dodging him, United were devoid of a director of communications and their World Cup participants were on holiday.

To compound that, Woodward was struggling to recruit a centre back and a winger. After United's last friendly against Bayern Munich, a smiling Mourinho told MUTV: "Finally, it's over. Our pre-season is over."

Following the final tour match against Real Madrid, Mourinho held an encore at the Hard Rock Stadium in Miami, reminding his audience United's under 23s were relegated the previous season and their "quality was not good".
Some survivors of that team were about to board the United bus for Miami airport. Mourinho threw them under it.

It struck a portentous tone but Mourinho was right. The five-game tour was a largely meaningless excursion and those experiences have doubtless had a bearing on United trimming their Stateside commitments to three games this summer.

For the opening friendly in Trondheim on Monday, MUTV struggled to maintain its North Korea standards. Ronny Johnsen, the United ambassador-cum-pundit, went off-message when he noted how "quiet" it was at the Lerkendal Stadion.
When Erik ten Hag sidled over for a post-match debrief, the presenter informed him the "result is secondary". "The result is not secondary," Ten Hag corrected him.
Ten Hag stressed United were "not good enough", the "performance was below the standards" and "this is not the standard for top football".
United did not have top players. Of the 25 in Trondheim, only Jonny Evans and Mason Mount are certain to be in the squad next season. Evans has earned that privilege. Mount hasn't.

Videographers are all the rage now among Gen Z footballers and one charted Hannibal Mejbri's workout during his holiday. Mejbri promised a "special season". There was nothing special about his performance.
Mejbri was busy off the ball and ineffectual on it, as he was during his four starts last season. Rosenborg are 14 games into the Norwegian campaign but they are also 11th in a 16-team league.

United's best player was a lad who had never appeared for the first team before. United's goal led a charmed life as Rosenborg struck the woodwork four times and Radek Vitek pulled off two world-class saves either side of the interval.
"Let's say he (Vitek) got the opportunity from the team to make some very good saves," Ten Hag shrugged. His negative analysis has been buried on the club website.

Ten Hag, like Mourinho six years ago, is into his third pre-season as United manager and not mincing his words. It was jarring that he could be so positive in defeat last season having been constructively critical in victory during his first term.

Some may feel Ten Hag went overboard over a perfunctory friendly. United have headed to Norway in five of their last seven proper pre-season schedules and invariably it has not been worth their while.

There was a spiky defeat to Atletico Madrid two years ago and Kobbie Mainoo imposed himself during a 45-minute run-out against Leeds last year. There was little to write home about from playing against Valerenga, Kristiansund and Rosenborg. The latter two 1-0s were settled by goals in added time.

The standard of opposition was not the issue on Monday as Rosenborg were enterprising and intense. Too many in red went through the motions. United were marginally better in the second half with an academy XI.

Two of their starters were Champions League winners, three had World Cup experience and five have started in FA Cup finals. United's only attempt on target in the first half was from the 18-year-old Ethan Wheatley, a rare bright spark.

Ten Hag could have dismissed the result and the performance yet this is a team that plummeted to eighth in the Premier League last season and collected the wooden spoon in their Champions League group. Even MUTV has to host some home truths.
United will field a stronger side against Rangers in Edinburgh on Saturday and possibly a more senior XI a week later against Arsenal in Los Angeles.
That should quell any fear and loathing.

headline: Erik ten Hag gesture hints at chance for Manchester United youngster to solve problem position
body: Man Utd need a defensive midfielder to come through the ranks and they could have one in the making after a bright debut in Trondheim for Toby Collyer.
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info

When Casemiro took off the captain's armband in the away dressing room at Lerkendal and strapped it onto Toby Collyer's bicep, the symbolism would have hung heavy in the air. This wasn't a changing of the guard just yet, but Manchester United's two captains on the night hinted at careers going in different directions.

For Casemiro, this was the kind of start to pre-season he didn't want. It's perhaps a little surprising the 32-year-old is still around, but interest from Saudi Arabia hasn't emerged and as it stands he looks likely to see through a third campaign in Manchester. He needs the snap to return to his game.

His last competitive involvement was pulling out of the FA Cup final squad between the teamsheets being submitted and then confirmed. He was due to be a substitute at Wembley but felt tightness and withdrew. It summed up a season in which he looked and played like a veteran entering the twilight of his career.

The Brazilian doesn't turn 33 until February but has had a demanding career in Europe and has a build that suggests fitness doesn't always come easily to him. He was a weak link in United's midfield for much of last season, although the open nature of that department didn't exactly offer him much protection.

Maybe he will be better in a smarter system this term and against Rosenborg there were a couple of nice passes, but he fell over scuffing a clearance in his box and was pounced on and lost possession just outside the area. It was an inauspicious start for a player who will want to prove the career obituaries are being penned too early.
It was certainly a contrast to Collyer, who strode onto the pitch with his socks rolled low, looking more of a throwback than the man he had replaced. But he played like a modern No.6.

His former Brighton Under-18s coach Mark Beard once labelled him the best defensive midfielder in the country for his age. He is a month older than Adam Wharton, who has excelled for first-team exposure and was part of England's Euro 2024 squad, although he didn't kick a ball.

Until Monday night, the closest Collyer had come to playing on a big stage was in the academy friendly against Wrexham in San Diego a year ago. This was a bigger night than that and he looked the part in a callow second-half side.

He was combative and strong in the tackle, took up intelligent positions to block attacks and used the ball well, happy to receive it from the defence or goalkeeper Radek Vitek and try and keep it moving forward. One flick on the left touchline to the advancing Harry Amass was a stylish contribution.

Collyer recently signed a new four-year contract at Old Trafford and although he hasn't yet played for the first team, Erik ten Hag insisted on being present for the signing of the paperwork. This is a player he rates highly, as seen by the decision to give him the captaincy for the second half on Monday night.

He will get further chances this summer as well. Collyer is expected to go on the pre-season tour to the United States, with Scott McTominay and Christian Eriksen returning from their summer breaks to boost options in midfield. Ten Hag has urged the youngsters involved in pre-season to take their opportunity, just as Kobbie Mainoo did a year ago. Collyer could be the biggest beneficiary of more first-team exposure.

He plays in a position that United have struggled to fill for a long time now. Casemiro looked to be the answer in his first season but the £70m signing now has questions to answer. There is still a chance United sell and look to sign a younger player in that position during this window.

Sofyan Amrabat contributed last season and United still haven't decided whether to try and sign the 27-year-old on a permanent deal, though the player is keen to return to Old Trafford. Amrabat isn't good enough in possession and it would be a retrograde step, while Ten Hag has decided McTominay is best utilised further forward and there is interest again in the Scot this summer.

It's expecting too much for Collyer to force his way into the starting XI for the opening day of the league campaign, but he could emerge as a rotation option this season. If Casemiro does go a replacement will be signed, but with a little more experience under his belt, Collyer could become a first-team option in a position where United really need a succession plan.

headline: Manchester United give Tyrell Malacia update as training footage emerges
body: Tyrell Malacia hasn't played for Man United in more than a year and is continuing his recovery from a serious knee injury.
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Manchester United have released training footage of Tyrell Malacia completing light individual training on the grass at Carrington.

Malacia last played a competitive fixture for the Netherlands in the UEFA Nations League on June 14 but went under the knife a month later shortly after pre-season began. The defender sustained a knee injury at the end of the 2022/23 campaign and surgery was eventually required, despite United initially looking to manage it with pain injections.

After that initial operation, Malacia required another round of surgery and his prolonged absence has been a source of frustration for Erik ten Hag, but he's now closing in on a return to full fitness and is currently undergoing an individual programme to complete his rehabilitation.

United released fresh footage of Malacia training individually under the guidance of a member of medical staff and he is wearing a device around his left knee. For the first time since his injury, Malacia was seen with the ball at his feet during the session, which suggests he could be available for selection in August.

It's understood the club are carefully handling Malacia's return to prevent any further setbacks, as the player has already missed more than a year during his time on the sidelines. United went the majority of the season without their senior left-backs, Luke Shaw and Malacia, due to injury and Sergio Reguilon was signed on loan as a stopgap signing.

Ten Hag went on record to express his frustration at injuries in that area and many fans believe United should sign a new left-back in the summer transfer window. Malacia was on crutches after his initial injury and spent some time in the Netherlands to recover, and a source indicated he was expected to return before 2024.

However, Malacia's setback delayed his return and Shaw sustaining different muscle injuries throughout the season compounded the problem at left-back. Malacia has made a total of 39 appearances for United.

headline: Kobbie Mainoo verdict on latest Manchester United transfer speaks volumes
body: Willy Kambwala has left Manchester United to join Villarreal and the teenage defender has been wished well by his former Old Trafford team-mates
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Kobbie Mainoo has sent his best wishes to Willy Kambwala following confirmation of the young defender's transfer to Villarreal.

Kambwala, who made his first-team debut for Manchester United against West Ham in the Premier League last season, racked up eight league appearances and featured twice in the FA Cup. He now heads to Spain in a deal that could reach £9.6 million.

The departure of the ex-Sochaux talent marks the second paid exit from United this summer, with Donny van de Beek earlier moving to Girona for an initial fee of £500,000 plus add-ons. This figure is notably less than the £35 million United spent to bring him from Ajax in 2020.

Mainoo, who played alongside Kambwala in the UEFA Youth League before establishing himself in the senior squad, expressed his support on social media, commenting "Big love bro, all the best," on Kambwala's Instagram post announcing his move.

Kambwala shared his gratitude and reflections on his time at United: "Dear @manchesterunited, I arrived at the club as a boy with a dream and today I'm leaving like a young man who has fulfilled his dream," he posted. "From the academy to the first team, it's time for me to start a new adventure after 4 wonderful seasons at the club".

He continued, acknowledging those who supported him during his journey: "Thank you to all the people I have met during these 4 years. Coaches, my teammates, staff members, workers in Carrington and members of my host family."
"I'll never forget what you all did for me. A special thank you to you fans who have always supported me, you are the soul of this club. I wish you the best for this season and for the future."

United have inserted a buy-back option into Kambwala's deal, as well as a significant sell-on clause. The 19 year old joins former Old Trafford star Eric Bailly at his new club, as well as several other former Premier League men including Alexander Sorloth and Juan Foyth.

Mainoo wasn't the other United academy talent to wish the defender well. Joe Hugill, Dan Gore and Maxi Oyedele all shared messages of support, as did Toby Collyer, who recently signed a new contract at Old Trafford.

Ethan Wheatley also shared a message for Kambwala, and the young striker was among those to get minutes for United in their first pre-season match against Rosenborg on Monday. The Norwegian side won 1-0 thanks to a late goal from Noah Holm, and manager Erik ten Hag demanded better from his players after senior stars including Marcus Rashford and Casemiro joined a squad primarily made up of youngsters.
"The result is not secondary," Ten Hag said. "Our performance as a team is by far not good enough. This is not the standard of top football. We are Man Utd, we should perform better".

headline: Yoro, Branthwaite and De Ligt sign - Manchester United's perfect £150m transfer window simulated
body: We simulated the 2024/25 season with Jarrad Branthwaite, Matthijs de Ligt and Leny Yoro all at Man United to see what could happen
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Manchester United have made moves for defenders Jarrad Branthwaite, Matthijs de Ligt and Leny Yoro this summer, but what could happen if all three signed?

It's no secret that United are in the market for new centre-backs this summer. With Raphael Varane having departed the club and Victor Lindelof expected to be sold, defence is a priority in the transfer window with Erik ten Hag's side closing in on a few new arrivals.

Personal terms have been agreed with De Ligt while Yoro has agreed to join the club despite interest from Real Madrid. A deal could still be done for Branthwaite after United's first two bids were rejected.
But if United were to have the perfect summer transfer window and all three defenders signed, how could they fare next season? Let's take a look...

To set up this simulation, we used Football Manager 2024 to move the defensive trio to United in the summer transfer window for a combined fee of £150million. We then simulated the 2024/25 season, and this is how the defenders got on.

Ten Hag was keen to play his new additions as much as possible, with the Dutchman eventually deciding to move Lisandro Martinez into midfield to accommodate his signings. This worked a treat, with all three defenders playing regularly in their first season at the club.

De Ligt and Branthwaite was the partnership that saw the most game time in the simulation, with the latter making 41 appearances, one more than De Ligt. As the least experienced, Yoro was eased into the squad, but in his 28 appearances the Frenchman averaged a rating of 7.03 per game along with five assists - the same rating as De Ligt, and higher than Branthwaite (6.98).
At the end of the 2024/25 season, Football Manager 2024 put together an overall best United XI, based on performances, statistics, and other metrics. This is what it looked like:
Full United best XI: (4-3-3):  Onana; Dalot, De Ligt, Branthwaite, Shaw; Martinez, Fernandes, Mainoo; Garnacho, Hojlund, Rashford.

De Ligt and Branthwaite were the centre-back partnership in the best XI, with Yoro missing out. Martinez made the best XI as a holding midfielder, with Bruno Fernandes and Kobbie Mainoo completing the midfield three.

New signing Joshua Zirkzee failed to make the best XI with Rasmus Hojlund scoring more goals than the Dutchman. Both Maguire and Lindelof were sold in the simulation, leaving little competition for the new signings.

With De Ligt, Branthwaite and Yoro all settling in nicely at Old Trafford, their impact was felt in the Premier League, with Ten Hag's side improving massively in the 2024/25 season. At the end of the campaign, United finished fifth, but it was their defensive record that impressed the most.

20 wins, 13 draws, and five losses saw United end the season on 73 points, 13 more than the previous season, and only seven points off the top four. Ten Hag's side conceded just 31 goals in the league, giving them the joint-best defensive record in the league along with Tottenham.

United earned a spot in the Champions League for the following season in the simulation, but it wasn't to do with finishing fifth. A fantastic European campaign saw Ten Hag's side win the Europa League, with Marcus Rashford scoring twice as United beat Borussia Dortmund 2-1 in the final.

Overall, FM24 predicts that if United can sign Branthwaite, De Ligt and Yoro, their defence could improve drastically, with Ten Hag's side winning a European trophy in the simulation. The triple signing also saw Martinez move into midfield, a switch that definitely worked.
Who do you want United to sign this summer? Let us know in the comments!
Follow the MEN's United coverage on TikTok and YouTube, and subscribe to the Manchester is Red podcast.

headline: Erik ten Hag breaks silence on Jadon Sancho future at Manchester United after talks are held
body: Jadon Sancho held talks with Erik ten Hag last week as he came in from the cold to return to first-team training at Man Utd.
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info

Erik ten Hag has offered Jadon Sancho the chance of a fresh start at Manchester United after telling the winger he has drawn a line under their disagreement that threatened to end the winger's Old Trafford career.

Sancho has returned to first-team training at United and could be offered a second chance by Ten Hag after clear-the-air talks were held at Carrington last week, with the pair patching up their differences at the start of pre-season training.

The 24-year-old was expected to leave the club after spending the second half of last season on loan at Borussia Dortmund, having been banished from United's first-team squad in September after he accused Ten Hag of lying over the reason for his absence from the matchday squad at Arsenal.

The United boss said Sancho had been left out after poor performances in training, but the England winger took to social media to reject the claim. After refusing to apologise he was axed from the first-team group and had to train alone.
As recently as May United had intended to sell Sancho, but interest from Dortmund hasn't firmed up and Julian Brandt has been handed Sancho's No.10 shirt, leading to a reconciliation at United.

Ten Hag was non-commital on Sancho's long-term future and didn't want to open up on his talks with the £73m winger, but he has offered an olive branch and Sancho is expected to feature in pre-season at some point.
"As we said, we draw the line. Manchester United need good players and Jadon is a good player. We have drawn that line and we move on," said Ten Hag.

headline: Jorge Mendes net worth - meet super agent behind Leny Yoro's Man United transfer
body: Man United look set to sign highly-rated Lille centre-back Leny Yoro with super agent Jorge Mendes playing a key role
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Manchester United are closing in on the signing of French centre-back Leny Yoro.

The Lille defender is one of European football's most promising talents with United set to beat European champions Real Madrid and rivals Liverpool to his signature. Yoro is set to complete a medical at Carrington in a deal rising to €70million (£58.7m).

One figure who is influential in United's second transfer of the summer after the signing of Joshua Zirkzee is so-called super agent Jorge Mendes. The Portuguese is regarded as one of football's most famous administrators and has a lengthy list of famous footballers on his books.
Mendes is Yoro's agent and will help the 18-year-old complete the biggest move of his young career so far. Below is a look at the 58-year-old from Lisbon...

Jorge Mendes’ arrival on the scene as a football agent followed a career as a DJ and nightclub owner in his native Portugal. Seeing the booming market of player trading, aided by the Bosman Ruling of 1995 that allowed for the free movement of players at the end of their contracts, Mendes set up the Gestifute agency in 1996, with his first deal being to represent former Spurs and Wolves boss Nuno Espirito Santo for his switch from Vitoria de Guimaraes to Deportivo La Coruna.

Mendes went on to become the most prominent agent in the country, and with the talent to emanate from Portugal becoming of huge value to the European market, aided in no small part by Cristiano Ronaldo, Mendes went on to build one of world football’s most lucrative agencies.
Other notable stars who he represents include Manchester City's Ruben Dias, Ederson and Bernardo Silva as well as Liverpool's Darwin Nunez and Diogo Jota.
Mendes manages over £1bn in player contracts, while Forbes pegs his own net worth, largely gained through his significant commissions for representation, at around £80m (€104m).
Reports from our colleagues at the Mirror claimed in April that United would tap into the contacts book of Mendes in a bid to improve their recruitment of players.

And that certainly appears to be coming to fruition with the club set to beat Madrid and Liverpool to the signing of Yoro. Mendes is also the agent of another United-linked player in Benfica midfielder Joao Neves.

headline: Everton fire cryptic Jarrad Branthwaite message amid Man United Leny Yoro transfer confusion
body: Manchester United transfer news as Everton send a clear Jarrad Branthwaite message as the summer saga took another twist following the news Leny Yoro could move to Old Trafford
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info

Everton have made their stance regarding Jarrad Branthwaite perfectly clear yet again for Manchester United with a well-timed social media post. As the Red Devils close in on signing Leny Yoro, the summer saga is still yet to be finished.

Having already had two bids for Branthwaite rejected, United are not out of the race to sign the Englishman despite an outlay of nearly £100million soon to be committed to deals already this summer. After Joshua Zirkzee arrived as the first incoming of the window, more are expected to follow.

United have not ruled out the possibility of purchasing three new centre-backs before the new season, especially with exits for Victor Lindelof and Harry Maguire not ruled out, while Raphael Varane has already departed.

Branthwaite looked set to be the priority target for Sir Jim Ratcliffe in his first summer window but a significant gap in valuations between Everton and United saw that one stall. Attention quickly turned to Matthijs de Ligt and Yoro, both of whom could be United players before long.

It has left Everton in a position to start initial pre-season preparations with Branthwaite in their squad, and don't the social media team know it. Just hours after MEN Sport reported that Yoro had agreed to join United in a transfer worth £52million (that could rise to almost £59million with add-ons), they posted a series of images of the left-footed defender in training.

"JB." the Toffees wrote alongside pictures of Branthwaite in the gym, on the training pitch, and doing some light stretches plus ball work. It is also noticeable that Everton's post came amid the understanding that the Merseysiders are confused by United's price standpoint.

Having declined to stretch to over £45million for a Premier League-proven 21-year-old, United have instead opted to put their money at this stage towards a Ligue 1 option - who is still a teenager. Everton are surprised at the decision, especially considering Yoro is out of contract in 12 months.
Branthwaite is now gearing up for pre-season with Everton whilst United are about to bring in one of the best defensive talents on the planet.
United have unveiled their new adidas home kit with new front-of-shirt sponsors for the 2024/25 season - and you can get your hands on it right now.

headline: 'I like to entertain' - Joshua Zirkzee names three things he will bring after Man United transfer
body: Joshua Zirkzee became Man Utd's first signing of the summer and he sat down with club media to share more about himself
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Manchester United's newest signing Joshua Zirkzee has described himself as 'creative, good with the ball and unpredictable'.
United completed the signing of Zirkzee from Bologna for €42.5million last Sunday and the forward signed a five-year contract, with includes the option of another year.
Bologna defied the odds to finish in the Italian top four last term. They enjoyed their best season since 1967/1968 and Zirkzee started 32 out of a possible 38 league games.
Zirkzee contributed 11 goals and five assists in those appearances and finished the campaign as Bologna's top goalscorer, which caught United's attention.
The 23-year-old will compete with Rasmus Hojlund to start for United in the new season, but as a versatile talent, it's also thought he can play across the attacking front line.
Zirkzee sat down with club media as part of his unveiling and his interview, which covered his transfer to the club and what he will bring, was released on Wednesday afternoon.

"I have a lot of trust and a good feeling about this step," Zirkzee told MUTV. "It wasn't a difficult decision. I mean, I love Bologna a lot, but Manchester United just gave me a very, very good feeling.
"I'm confident that what's planned will also happen. It's been a rollercoaster the past, the past few weeks. But, Yeah, some very good experiences. And I'm very happy to be here.

"Obviously, at a good point [in his career]. I mean, making a transfer to Manchester United is obviously something very positive. So, yeah, I just, can't wait to get started. And, and continue what I basically did last season. Just hoping to improve every day and, and do the best I can."
Zirkzee was asked to describe his qualities and said: "Creative player, good with the ball. Yeah, I’m just, a bit unpredictable at times. So, yeah, I think those are the perfect words for me, yeah."

When asked whether he likes to entertain supporters on the pitch, he added: "A little bit. It's best to entertain with the whole team. Not necessarily as an individual, but, yeah, I think, you have to make the fans who come to the stadium happy as well about the game."I mean, as a young boy growing up, playing mostly with tougher, bigger guys who are older than you, makes you adapt. So, I think, I think it's something that you learn at a young age in Holland. Especially where I'm from, this was the case."
Erik ten Hag has signed multiple Dutch players since his appointment from Ajax and Zirkzee mentioned that connection. "It's an extra privilege, of course because he's Dutch," he said.

"I'm Dutch as well. So, but I think, besides that, it's obviously not the only reason why I came here. I mean, Manchester United is a great, huge club. So it's is just an extra, privilege and benefit for me."

Zirkzee will also work with the newly appointed Ruud van Nistelrooy. "Having some, some Dutch people around obviously makes it a bit easier," he said. "To be fair, I'm an easy-going person. I'm not too difficult with, adapting, so, but, yeah, it's always nice, to have them around."

At the end of the interview, Zirkzee discussed his football heroes and recalled he would get in trouble with his mother as a child for spending too much time playing football."Ronaldinho was, for sure my hero. as I grew older, Ibrahimovic as well, was, someone I really looked up to, but I think Ronaldinho was, was my favourite," said Zirkzee."I hope she [his mum] forgives me now for all the times I came home late. Or, if I broke something in the in the backyard or even, even just at home. So eventually, it all worked out pretty well.
"But, yeah, that was just life back, back when I was younger. Play football, forget about the time and getting, getting back home late. Yeah. it turned out pretty well."
After representing the Netherlands at Euro 2024, Zirkzee will now be given some time off and is only expected to link up with his new teammates in early August.
He could make his debut against Fulham on the opening day of the Premier League season.

headline: I spoke to Erik ten Hag about Jadon Sancho and the new Man United era - his answers spoke volumes
body: Man Utd manager Erik ten Hag spoke to the media for the first time since he survived an end-of-season review to remain in charge of the club.
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info

Erik ten Hag strode purposefully through the double doors protecting the sanctity of the dressing room and tunnel area at the Lerkendal Stadion and into a bustling mixed zone dominated by Norwegian journalists and TV crews.

He strode over to the three British journalists who had made the trip to the north of Norway to watch Manchester United's opening pre-season friendly of the summer, shook our hands and exchanged the briefest of small talk. He had had a good summer, he said. Everyone knows where he holidayed, that's for sure. He was still in Ibiza when he found out his job was safe.

In truth, small talk has rarely been Ten Hag's thing. The mind goes back to his first sit-down with the written journalists covering United's pre-season tour of Thailand and Australia in 2022. In an attempt to put him at ease, we planned to ask the golf enthusiast if he caught the end of The Open the previous evening. "Not that much," came the reply.

It feels like it's all business with Ten Hag, which is no bad thing, so we got straight into it again in Norway, but not before he asked the local journalists not to record the conversation. He made it clear this was for the three of us who had followed United out here, a gesture always appreciated in friendlies that come with no contractual obligations from a media perspective.

In truth, getting to speak to Ten Hag was going to be more important for us than the game. It was a young, low-key squad and a forgettable fixture. When the manager came out to speak we breathed a sigh of relief. The presence of a backpack revealed this was his final act of the night.

Over the next seven-and-a-half minutes a range of topics were discussed, although not necessarily in that much depth. As Ten Hag's first public media appearance since surviving as manager, this was a noteworthy moment, but also not the environment to go into detail, with the engine of the coach ticking over just outside and a private jet waiting on the tarmac at Vaernes Airport 20 miles away.

Ten Hag's first act was to recouch the criticism he had delivered to MUTV post-match, including himself in those responsible, although there was again a hint that he might not be happy about the physical conditioning of some members of the squad.

Primarily, this was Ten Hag again defensive of his record. When asked if this felt like a fresh start, his immediate response was to point to the two trophies in two seasons, a record only Manchester City can surpass, as he pointed out. To the final question, as to whether fans can be confident this campaign won't be like last season, Ten Hag's first words in reply were "but we won a trophy".

There was an acceptance it was a "complicated season" and an understanding that ambitions must be higher, but in what feels like a new era Ten Hag is still happy to point to old records. He has the Carabao Cup and the FA Cup on his CV at Old Trafford and he isn't going to let anyone forget it.

He was positive about the new structure at the club, although pointed out that his working relationship with sporting director Dan Ashworth is only just over a week old. Still, Ten Hag clearly feels Ineos have delivered new energy to the place and that could be beneficial moving forward. It did feel telling that he stressed the new structure couldn't fix all the club's problems in such a short space of time. Don't expect miracles, in other words.

The tensest things got was when the subject of Jadon Sancho was brought up. A truce has been called, but nobody at United has confirmed whether Sancho actually apologised or not during his talks with Ten Hag. When the winger's name was raised the manager didn't exude warmth.

Two questions about the £73m man elicited just 35 words in response and the phrase "we draw the line" was uttered three times. That stock phrase was repeated when it was put that it was now up to Sancho to take the opportunity of a fresh start. You didn't leave with the impression that the two were going to forge a long and happy relationship from this point on.

Ten Hag's relationship with United endures, however. There was a final handshake, a thanks for taking the time to stop, and he was gone. The first signpost of a new start and the chance to remind people of old triumphs.

headline: Full confirmed list of Manchester United ins and outs after Joshua Zirkzee transfer
body: All the latest transfer news at Old Trafford as Manchester United continue their business throughout the summer window
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Manchester United have started to really kick their summer transfer window into gear as manager Erik ten Hag begins to revitalize and upgrade his squad ahead of the 2024/25 campaign.

The deadline for accounting deals into the 2023/24 Profitability and Sustainability (PSR) period is now over following the June 30 deadline, meaning that United can knowingly splash out on stars but will be wary of needing to keep the books balanced.

In a window that's expected to see a myriad of defensive additions to help solidify their backline, Ten Hag's first arrival was actually a forward in the form of Joshua Zirkzee from Bologna, but with Lille defender Leny Yoro set for a medical in the UK later this week, it seems clear that things are just getting started at Old Trafford.
With all of that being said, we've pulled together the full list of United's ins and outs now the summer window has been open for a few weeks...
Joshua Zirkzee - Bologna - £36.5million
Raphael Varane - End of contract
Anthony Martial - End of contract
Shola Shoretire - End of contract
Brandon Williams - End of contract
Omari Forson - Monza - Free transfer
Willy Kambwala - Villarreal - £10million
Donny Van de Beek - Girona - £500k
Alvaro Carreras - Benfica - £5million

headline: Sir Jim Ratcliffe has explained Man United's Leny Yoro transfer decision to Matthijs De Ligt
body: Manchester United are looking to complete a deal for Lille centre-back Leny Yoro, but it could put a move for Bayern Munich's Matthijs De Ligt on ice
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Manchester United are set to sign Lille centre-back Leny Yoro - putting a move for Bayern Munich's Matthijs De Ligt in doubt.

The French defender has agreed to join Erik ten Hag's team this summer in a deal rising to €70million (£58.7m). Yoro has been one of Europe's most sought-after centre-backs with Real Madrid and Liverpool also said to have been interested.

It's a move which continues to signal United's new approach to transfers under Ineos and new sporting director Dan Ashworth. Over the past decade, the club have been involved in frustrating transfer sagas, chasing players who they end up overpaying for or fail to secure.

And after signing Joshua Zirkzee from Bologna, MEN Sport understands that United are open to signing three new centre-backs after the departure of Raphael Varane and with the future of Victor Lindelof at Old Trafford in doubt.

De Ligt is another centre-back who United are looking to sign with the Dutchman knowing Ten Hag well from their time at Ajax together. However, a potential transfer for the Bayern defender may now be more difficult with United set to spend heavily on Yoro.

The Netherlands international is understood to have agreed a move to Manchester but United are yet to agree on a fee with his current club. It is claimed that they didn’t expect to sign both the 24-year-old and Yoro this summer, suggesting that a deal for De Ligt may not happen.

And previous words from United's co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe have suggested why the club may have prioritised a deal for the Frenchman over a move for the former Ajax star. Ratcliffe told former Tour de France winner Geraint Jones on his Cycling Club podcast in March that the club will be looking to sign potential stars of the future, rather than current big-name players.
"I think in a way what I would rather do is try to sign the next Mbappé than spend a fortune trying to buy success," Ratcliffe told Geraint Jones on his Cycling Club podcast.
"It's not that clever buying Mbappé, anyone can figure that one out. What's much more challenging is to find the next Mbappé or [Jude] Bellingham or Roy Keane."

Whilst De Ligt would no doubt improve United's defence, the signing of Yoro would be a bigger coup with the 18-year-old widely viewed as a generational talent. The similarities to Varane, when he was at Lens in France, are eerily similar, with United missing out on the then teenager in 2011.

This time though it looks like United may be about to beat the Spanish giants to a transfer in what would be a huge boost ahead of a vital 2024/25 campaign - and he appears to have everything needed to fit Ratcliffe's 'next Mbappe' transfer model.

headline: Man United can repeat Mason Mount transfer trick as 'enquiry' made for next move
body: Jonathan Tah has emerged as a potential transfer target for Man United this summer amid ongoing attempts to sign Jarrad Branthwaite, Matthijs de Ligt and Lille youngster Leny Yoro
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info

Manchester United have made no secret about their plan to strengthen at centre-back this summer and the main question to answer is which signatures will they eventually secure? Jarrad Branthwaite, Matthijs de Ligt and highly-rated Lille youngster Leny Yoro are on the shopping list for Erik ten Hag and key figures behind the scenes.

However, another man - Bundesliga-winning Bayer Leverkusen colossus Jonathan Tah - has emerged as a possible alternative with the wheels in motion for a defensive rebuild. Reports from Sky Germany underline the 28-year-old as a viable and attainable option on the proviso Branthwaite, De Ligt or Yoro slip away.

Netherlands international De Ligt - well known to manager Ten Hag from their days together at Ajax - has verbally agreed personal terms as he aims to kick-start a promising career that has stalled for club and country. But while he might not break the bank as such, Everton are playing hard ball with Branthwaite's valuation.

It's said the Merseyside outfit are holding out for between £70million and £80million and signing over that cheque, regardless of his talent, might not be the smartest move. Yoro, meanwhile, is claimed to have Real Madrid no other on red alert - as the Branthwaite conundrum flags up an all-too-familiar mistake.

United have been among the worst spenders in world football for at least a decade and, with INEOS on board and controlling transfers, the intention is to pay smart money and make better footballing and business decisions. They were stung in that regard 12 months ago when snapping-up Mason Mount from Chelsea.

That is not to say Mount was not worth signing, nor would Branthwaite be. However, amid lingering FFP caution - which could yet be eased with further sales - spending a huge chunk of the budget on one marquee signing might restrict what else United can do in the market.

INEOS will not want to spread themselves too thinly either by bringing in too many cheap options, but Tah fits the bill for a happy middle ground. He is coming off the back of a hugely impressive and successful season as part of an all-conquering Leverkusen side that earned rave reviews under Xabi Alonso.

Tah was also a regular for Germany at Euro 2024 on home soil - partnering Antonio Rudiger in a back four - while a loophole with his contract has emerged to thrust his name on to the radar. With 12 months to run on his deal -just like Mount had - there are clubs taking note including United and the mighty Bayern Munich.

Even taking 'the English tax' into consideration, United overpaid for Mount at a similar juncture. INEOS, though, will not let that happen with Tah representing an opportunity that should not be missed.

headline: Jeremie Frimpong sends perfect Joshua Zirkzee message after Man United complete transfer
body: Jeremie Frimpong has been linked with a move to Manchester United this summer and he could reunite with Netherlands teammate Joshua Zirkzee if he made the switch to Old Trafford
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Jeremie Frimpong has sent a message to Joshua Zirkzee after the forward completed his move to Manchester United over the weekend.

The Red Devils unveiled the signing of Zirkzee from Bologna for a fee in the region of £35.8million, which will be paid over the course of three years. The 23-year-old has signed a five-year contract at Old Trafford with the option of a further season. He scored 12 goals and provided seven assists in 37 matches last season.

After his move was announced, Zirkzee posted a photo of himself on Instagram in the dressing room wearing a United jumper in front of a new shirt with the caption: "An honor. Happy and proud to be part of this club. Can't wait to get started!" followed with three red circle emojis.

And Netherlands teammate Frimpong, who has himself been linked with a move to United this summer, decided to leave his well wishes in the comments section. He wrote: "Joshyyyyyy," accompanied with two red love heart emojis. Zirkzee replied with a love heart emoji and a smiley face emoji.

Frimpong enjoyed a fine season at Bayer Leverkusen, scoring 14 goals and assisting 12 times from right wing back. He helped Xabi Alonso's side win the Bundesliga title. Having impressed, Frimpong's future has come under question with a number of clubs across Europe tracking his progress ahead of a potential transfer.

According to BILD, Frimpong has a release clause worth between £33.6m and £37.8m but that is set to expire this week, meaning interested parties, including United, may have to act fast before his value increases even further. It's been reported that United could move for the Dutchman if Aaron Wan-Bissaka leaves.

Frimpong could follow another Netherlands international, including Zirkzee, to Old Trafford with Matthijs de Ligt heavily linked with a switch across to Manchester. It's emerged that the 24-year-old has made it clear that he would be open to a move to United, having struggled for regular game time at Bayern Munich.

As for Zirkzee, he said after his move to United was completed: "Having had discussions with the manager and the leaders of the club I know how exciting the future is going to be here and I cannot wait to play my part in achieving success for Manchester United.

"I am a player who has always dedicated everything to winning; I'm ready for this next challenge, to go to another level in my career and win more trophies. It is a privilege to join such an iconic club. I have to take a short break now after being with the national team, but I'll be coming back ready to make an impact straight away."

headline: I heard the reaction for divisive Manchester United star and thought about his future
body: Man United kicked off their pre-season with a loss against Rosenborg on Monday and here is what you might have missed.
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Manchester United began their pre-season schedule by losing 1-0 against Rosenborg.
United have a huge and loyal following in Scandinavia and the Reds played in front of a sold-out Lerkendal Stadium, although the fans in attendance weren't treated to a goal-fest.
That was largely down to Radek Vitek, who delivered a man-of-the-match performance in between the sticks for United to deny Rosenborg a more dominant win on home soil.
The travelling squad at Erik ten Hag's disposal in Trondheim was youthful and just five senior players, Jonny Evans, Aaron Wan-Bissaka, Casemiro, Mason Mount and Marcus Rashford, made the trip.
Those five first-team players were substituted at half-time as wholesale changes were made, which saw Vitek keep his place and 10 youngsters come on.
Vitek made a string of excellent saves throughout the match and will be hopeful of playing against Rangers this weekend. Here are the moments you might have missed...

You could argue Marcus Rashford is currently like Marmite among United supporters: he splits opinion. The forward enjoyed the best campaign of his career in 2022/23 but spectacularly regressed last term and his off-field behaviour damaged his relationship with fans.
Rashford, at least, ended the season with a positive showing in the FA Cup final and many believed missing out on the England squad would allow him to refocus this summer.

There is a lot for Rashford to prove in the new campaign. He must deliver consistently strong displays again and perform to the level he's capable of, otherwise, the 2024/25 season could be his last representing his hometown club and the team he supported as a boy.

There were times when Old Trafford's frustration with Rashford was audible last term, but that didn't stop the crowd in Norway giving his name the biggest cheer when it was announced. Rashford was the biggest 'star' on the pitch in Trondheim and must deliver performances worthy of star status going forward, or his future at the club will be in bigger doubt.

When Hull City played Manchester City at the Etihad in December 2008, they embarrassingly trailed 4-0 after just 36 minutes and their furious manager, Phil Brown, famously made the unusual decision of giving his team talk on the pitch - not in the dressing room - at half-time.
It's a moment in Premier League history that won't be forgotten, mostly because a Hull player subsequently reenacted the team talk in a goal celebration a year later.
Ten Hag did his best impression of Phil Brown at the Lerkendal Stadium on Monday night, as he also decided to conduct his half-time team talk on the pitch during the break.
The Dutchman was seen in deep communication with his players, although with it being a pre-season friendly, he wasn't feeling the emotions Brown once felt at the Etihad.

Nonetheless, Ten Hag was strong in his analysis after the game and said: "The result is not secondary. We play pre-season, but it's the standard at Manchester United to win games - definitely don't lose them. The performance is more important but it was below our standards."
Maybe we'll see Ten Hag's team talk reenacted as a celebration at some stage this season after all.

There was a bizarre quirk before the game when goalkeeper coach Jelle ten Rouwelaar emerged to take the warm-up without his official appointment having been announced. Ten Rouwelaar put the goalkeepers through their paces before kick-off and at 4:17pm, United officially communicated his appointment across their social media channels.

The Dutchman has joined United as first-team goalkeeper coach and succeeds Richard Hartis, who departed this summer. Ten Rouwelaar has been Vincent Kompany's goalkeeping coach for the previous four years, first at Anderlecht and then at Burnley.
He left Turf Moor at the end of his contract and signed a deal with Ajax before United showed an interest, which meant it took €100,000 in compensation to appoint him.

Ten Rouwelaar will work with Andre Onana, Tom Heaton and Altay Bayindir at first-team level this season, but he'll coach Vitek during pre-season and the youngster can be immensely proud of the performance he delivered against Rosenborg on Monday evening.
Vitek is an imposing goalkeeper and will be hopeful of receiving more opportunities in United's friendlies this summer before another departure on loan again.

Interestingly, another Czech goalkeeper, Matej Kovar, impressed for United in pre-season last summer but he was sold to Bayer Leverkusen on a permanent deal. United banked £7.7million for Kovar, who was 23 years old when he left, but Vitek might have a better chance of breaking into the first-team squad in the future.

headline: Manchester United set to break 10-year transfer record after agreement reached
body: The latest Manchester United news as the forward looks set to move to French club Marseille after impressing on loan with Getafe last season.
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
The sale of Mason Greenwood this summer looks set to beat a post-Sir Alex Ferguson record for Manchester United with the forward on the verge of leaving Old Trafford.

After being sent on loan to Getafe last season, Greenwood’s performances caught the eye, after he scored eight times and provided six assists in 33 La Liga performances. The Spanish side were keen to sign him on a permanent deal but were unwilling to match United’s asking price.

That prompted interest from several other clubs, including Lazio and Marseille. And it seems like the latter are now closing in on a move for Greenwood with the Athletic reporting that an agreement has been reached with both United and the player over a transfer.

The move was put into doubt following criticism from supporters and the mayor of Marseille. Greenwood was suspended in January 2022 after being arrested for attempted rape, controlling and coercive behaviours and assault, but the case was dropped and all charged were withdrawn.

If the transfer to Marseille is completed, then it will see United earn an initial €27.6 million (£23.3m) with the fee potentially rising to €31.6 million (£26.7m) with add-ons. The profit made, seeing as Greenwood is an academy graduate, will be the most made since the retirement of Ferguson in 2013.

The sale will come as a boost to United in terms of the Premier League’s Profitability and Sustainability Rules (PSRs). Due to him being an academy player, money made will go down as pure profit in the books for the 2024/25 season.

It comes just days after United confirmed the signing of striker Joshua Zirkzee, who completed a move from Bologna for €42.5 million (£35.8m) over the weekend. The Dutchman has signed a five-year deal at Old Trafford with the option of a sixth.

headline: Jarrad Branthwaite to Man United transfer latest - Everton sale decision, bids rejected, £80m tag
body: The latest transfer news from Old Trafford as Man United continue to pursue Everton's Jarrad Branthwaite after having two bids turned down for the England U21s international.
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info

Manchester United and Everton are seemingly worlds apart when it comes to striking up a transfer for defender Jarrad Branthwaite with two offers already being rejected for the England international. United are still weighing-up moves for up to three centre-backs this summer as part of a defensive overhaul.

Matthijs de Ligt and Leny Yoro are the club's two other main targets after rubber-stamping a swoop for Bologna forward Joshua Zirkzee which has accounted for £36.5million in their budget. Getting all three defenders over the line will, meanwhile, be dependant on moving parts including the need for player sales.

Branthwaite, 22, is viewed as an ideal fit for the United rebuild and also worked with returning assistant manager Ruud van Nistelrooy during his successful loan spell with PSV Eindhoven in the 2022/2023 season. Here, we take a closer look at the latest headlines surrounding Branthwaite's future;

Leny Yoro has agreed to sign for Manchester United this summer in a deal that is set to rise to €70million (£58.7m) after Lille accepted a bid of €62million (£52m) earlier this week. The 18-year-old is set to be United's second signing of the summer after Bologna forward Joshua Zirkzee's arrival, and will likely be available to travel with United to Los Angeles for their pre-season tour next week.

Yoro is set to be part of a majorly-revamped defensive line which will see United attempt to patch up the evident holes from last season with three new signings, of which Yoro is one. Everton have already rejected two bids for their centre-back Jarrad Branthwaite while United are on the precipice of signing Bayern Munich star Matthijs De Ligt.
United have had two offers rejected for Branthwaite already this summer. But will it be third time lucky?

The second bid was worth £45million to Everton plus £5million in add-ons. It came after United saw a £43million attempt turned down last month, while Manchester Evening News reported in May that Branthwaite is valued at between £70million and £80million by the Toffeers - which United argue is unrealistic.

Previous deals for Harry Maguire to United (£80million), Wesley Fofana to Chelsea (£75million) and Josko Gvardiol to Manchester City (£77.6million) are viewed as justification for the price tag in Everton's eyes.

Everton have played hard ball from the outset when it comes to Branthwaite and business elsewhere means they do not necessarily have to cash-in on the England international this summer. Amadou Onana is seemingly ready to leave for Aston Villa in an agreement that will generate around £50million for the Toffees.
As such, they can continue to wait for a third, improved bid from United or ultimately hold firm.

Ongoing reports from The Liverpool ECHO and national publications indicate that Everton do not want or need to sell Branthwaite this summer. The 22-year-old remains under contract until 2027 having put pen-to-paper on a new deal at Goodison Park midway through last season.

The party line from Everton hints at business as usual. Branthwaite, who was overlooked for the England squad at Euro 2024 by now-departed national team manager Gareth Southgate this summer, is sharpening up his fitness as Everton head to Ireland to continue their pre-season preparations.
Branthwaite boarded the short flight from John Lennon Airport on Monday morning. As such, no immediate move appears to be on the cards for him - despite United's ongoing interest.

headline: Matthijs de Ligt to Man United transfer latest - Bayern Munich price, Yoro deal, Jonathan Tah option
body: The latest transfer news from Old Trafford as Man United continue to pursue Bayern Munich defender Matthijs de Ligt in an attempt to bolster their defensive options
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info

Manchester United are in the market to sign Matthijs de Ligt this summer as Erik ten Hag and key figures behind the scenes attempt to bolster their defensive options. United could recruit as many as three centre-backs during the transfer window with Everton's Jarrad Branthwaite and Leny Yoro also on their radar.

De Ligt needs no introduction for Ten Hag after the pair worked together at Ajax and at one point in time the former was regarded as the best young defender on the planet. While his career has, perhaps, stalled for club and country since then, the pedigree remains and Bayern Munich's loss could be United's gain.

Speculation over the 24-year-old Netherlands international and his future at the Allianz Arena continues to swirl . Here, we take a look at the latest headlines at home and abroad when it comes to his proposed transfer:

Leny Yoro has agreed to sign for Manchester United this summer in a deal that is set to rise to €70million (£58.7m) after Lille accepted a bid of €62million (£52m) earlier this week. The 18-year-old is set to be United's second signing of the summer after Bologna forward Joshua Zirkzee's arrival, and will likely be available to travel with United to Los Angeles for their pre-season tour next week.

Yoro is set to be part of a majorly-revamped defensive line which will see United attempt to patch up the evident holes from last season with three new signings, of which Yoro is one. Everton have already rejected two bids for their centre-back Jarrad Branthwaite while United are on the precipice of signing Bayern Munich star Matthijs De Ligt.

The Manchester Evening News understands United have verbally agreed personal terms with De Ligt regarding a move to Old Trafford this summer. However, as things stand, nothing concrete has been submitted to Bayern over his would-be signature - despite confidence in-house from United that a deal will eventually be done.

United have an existing relationship with De Ligt's agent, Rafaela Pimenta, while the defender is already known to Ten Hag from their days together at Ajax. In the market for up to three centre-backs this summer, Everton prospect Branthwaite and French youngster Yoro - from Lille - are the other primary targets.

Although personal terms have been verbally agreed, United have yet to make a formal offer for the Bayern player as they continue to weigh up all the options available to them. Exactly how much the German heavyweights want for his signature remains up in the air with contrasting indications across the board.

Reports from Sport BILD outline £42million as the asking price and indicate United would be willing to pay up. De Ligt - who progressed through the Ajax system and captained the Amsterdam giants as a teenager under no other than Ten Hag - has already amassed a staggering total transfer fund throughout his career.
Juventus paid €85.5million for him in 2019 and Bayern splashed out €67million coming up two years ago, but will it be third time lucky for United when it comes to a long-term target?

Sky Germany flag up Bayer Leverkusen defender Jonathan Tah as an alternative option for United if they fail to get De Ligt over the line. However, there is also a proposed scenario by which Tah heading to Bavaria instead would be the catalyst for De Ligt pitching up at Old Trafford as planned this summer.
Whispers that United are keeping tabs on Tah feature in a social media post. A transfer triangle could emerge as to speed up the process, depending on which club makes the first move.

headline: Manchester United player ratings vs Rosenborg as Radek Vitek brilliant and Casemiro sluggish
body: Man Utd began their preparations for the 2024/25 season with a friendly against Norwegian giants Rosenborg at their Lerkendal Stadion home.
Manchester United began their pre-season schedule with a 1-0 defeat against Rosenborg in Norway, with youngsters Ethan Wheatley and Ethan Ennis having the only chances of note for the visitors.

Aaron Wan-Bissaka, Jonny Evans, Casemiro, Mason Mount, Hannibal and Marcus Rashford all played the first 45 minutes at the Lerkendal stadium and they were only the first-team players involved in the fixture.

Erik ten Hag changed his entire outfield team for the second half, with only the impressive Radek Vitek remaining on. Rosenborg are midway through their domestic season and their greater match sharpness was in evidence, with United's goalkeeper denying them on several occasions.

The hosts also hit the woodwork four times before a 92nd-minute winner earned a victory they had probably merited. United now return to Carrington before Saturday's fixture against Rangers at Murrayfield.
Radek Vitek
A superb performance, reeling off a string of sharp saves with the best of the lot a one-handed effort to stop Sunde's shot. Also good on the ball and taking up high position. 9
Aaron Wan-Bissaka
Had little chance to get forward and couldn't find passes into midfield when he had the ball, going backwards and sidewards too often. 5
Will Fish
A busy outing as Rosenborg dominated the first-half. Had to work hard to keep a lively attacking trio quiet. 6
Jonny Evans
Comfortable on the ball and defended solidly on his first appearance since signing a new contract. 6
Sam Murray
Gave the ball away to give Rosenborg an early chance and struggled to tie down the lively Marius Broholm. 5
Casemiro
Hacked down by Nemcik early on but had already scuffed a clearance and later robbed of possession on the edge of his own box. A sluggish beginning. 5
Mason Mount
A promising start to pre-season. Lively on the ball and off it, turning away from challenges, tracking back diligently and creating a chance for Wheatley with a sharp pass. 7
Hannibal
His quick feet twice tempted Rosenborg players into tackles that won fouls but he offered little in possession in a central role behind the striker. 6
Ethan Williams
Struggled to get in the game, with United rarely offering much attacking threat and not getting the ball down their right. 5
Marcus Rashford
Carried the ball out from deep on one occasion and produced a moment of good skill, but was quiet with the United attack not clicking. 6
Ethan Wheatley
One excellent turn to find space to run into. Tried to link play and took up a good position to get a shot away and force Tangvik into a save. 7
Subs
Habeeb Ogunneye
Defended well in the second half and Rosenborg made few inroads down his flank. 7
Sonny Aljofree
Solid in possession and defended resolutely in the face of some pressure. 7
Rhys Bennett
Quieter than Aljofree but never shirked from the battle as Rosenborg piled forward. 6
Harry Amass
Looked assured in possession when he had it but given a tough time as Rosenborg overloaded the flank and regularly attacked down their right. 6
Toby Collyer
Looked like a throwback with his socks rolled low. Handed the captain's armband in another sign of the promise Ten Hag sees him and produced an excellent midfield performance. 8
Maxi Oyedele
Combative presence in midfield in the second half but United didn't see a lot of the ball. 6
Jack Fletcher
The first of Darren's twins to play for the first-team, even in a friendly, and worked hard to press but didn't see much of the ball. 6
Ethan Ennis
Forced the goalkeeper into a smart save and twice tried to cut infield to get a shot away from a more central area. 7
James Scanlon
A lively dribbler and one early run created panic in the Rosenborg defence. Looked a threat. 7
Joe Hugil
A willing runner but served up no chances and found it a battle to impose himself on the game. 6

headline: Manchester United give three youngsters professional contracts after treble-winning season
body: Man Utd have handed out three professional contracts, which represents an important milestone in the players' journeys.
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Manchester United youngsters Ashton Missin, Jacob Devaney and Tom Myles have signed their first professional contracts with the club.
United's Under-18s enjoyed a stunning season in the 2023/24, completing a treble and winning two of those trophies at the expense of rivals Manchester City.

Last season's U18 side were supremely talented and they have been compared to the FA Youth Cup winning squad of 2022, which included the likes of Alejandro Garnacho, Kobbie Mainoo, Willy Kambwala and Dan Gore.
Some of the U18 stars from last term have already been given professional contracts, which can only be signed once a player is 17, and United have handed out more deals this week.

Missin, who played on the left and right wing last season, has been given his first professional contract and he contributed four goals and two assists in the league. The 17-year-old was born in Halifax and is making up for lost time having been sidelined in 2022/23 with injury.
Devaney celebrated his 17th birthday last month, his natural position is defensive midfielder and he played 22 of a possible 24 games in the U18s' league campaign.
He was born in Yorkshire and his father, Martin Devaney, is the assistant coach at League One club Barnsley. Devaney qualifies to play for the Republic of Ireland through his grandparents.
Myles, who is a goalkeeper, made important saves on the way to the U18s' league triumph and kept eight clean sheets in 19 league appearances
The Manchester Evening News also understands Jack Kingdon, who impressed by delivering consistently strong displays for the U18s, has signed his first professional contract.
Kingdon, who has featured in Scotland's youth ranks (eligible through his father), trained with the first-team for the first time in April and captained the U18s on a few occasions.
Ethan Williams contributed 17 goals and nine assists in academy fixtures last season and his pre-agreed professional contract was activated this summer.

headline: Man United win race to seal wonderkid's future after interest from Chelsea, Liverpool and Newcastle
body: Man Utd youngster Bendito Mantato was subject to interest from rivals in the Premier League over the last few months.
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Manchester United youngster Bendito Mantato has signed a fresh scholarship with the club, which includes an agreement to sign a professional contract when he turns 17.
The Manchester Evening News exclusively revealed in March that Mantato was attracting interest from a handful of top Premier League clubs who wanted to poach him.

United would have received a six-figure sum in compensation if Mantato had switched clubs, as they have been responsible for his development to this stage, but the youngster has committed his future to United by signing a scholarship deal that includes a pre-pro contract.
Only the most highly regarded talents in the academy are given pre-pro contracts that activate when the player celebrates their 17th birthday and Mantato is included in that bracket.
Chelsea, Liverpool, Newcastle and Brighton showed an interest in signing Mantato but he will continue in Manchester and is relishing the prospect of making progress at United.
United were always hopeful Mantato would commit his future and eventually sign professional terms, and both parties are delighted he has signed as a first-year scholar.
The youngster, who has bundles of pace, was in excellent form last season and it's thought his long-term future will be on the right wing due to the attacking quality he can provide.

Mantato can play at left-back and on the wing, and his style has led to comparisons with Arsenal's Bukayo Saka, who started his career as a defender before moving forward. He joined United's academy aged nine and has represented England in the youth system - Mantato made his debut for the Three Lions' Under-16s team in February.
Mantato's dribbling ability is a huge asset and he's already been backed to have a bright future at Old Trafford.

headline: Manchester United reward talented young defender with first professional contract
body: Man United youngster Jack Kingdon made strong progress in the academy last season and has signed a professional deal.
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Manchester United youngster Jack Kingdon has signed his first professional contract with the club.
The Manchester Evening News understands Kingdon has put pen to paper on his first professional deal, which is the reward for his excellent progress in the academy.
Kingdon played a crucial role for the Under-18s last season as they claimed the treble, regularly starting in central defence and wearing the captain's armband on two occasions.

The MEN exclusively revealed Kingdon took part in first-team training for the first time in April. Last season's U18s team were supremely talented and Kingdon made a total of 27 appearances in the academy, going from strength to strength in the club's youth set up.
Kingdon, whose natural position is centre-back, delivered a string of impressive displays and now his pro deal is officially signed, he will attempt to make a senior debut.
Ethan Wheatley was the most recent academy youngster to be given his debut and the expectation inside United is that more debuts from last season's U18 team will follow.
Kingdon's quality helped the U18s concede just 28 league goals last term, the second-fewest in the division behind Manchester City, who conceded 27 goals.
The 18-year-old, who was born in Bolton, started his career with Greater Manchester grassroots club FC Strikerz Avengers before joining Morecambe at Under-12 level.

Kingdon notably made an appearance for Morecambe's U18s when his age group was Under-14 level. United eventually signed the youngster for a six-figure sum in November 2020, following a successful two-week trial period at the club, and he's made excellent progress since joining.

The defender played multiple positions at grassroots level, including as a striker and midfielder, but he's since excelled at centre-back and he's considered very strong, pacy and someone who can read the game well from the back.

Kingdon stands at 6ft 1in and briefly played rugby as a child but wanted to prioritise football. He was also a gifted athlete, as he once took gold medals in the 75m, 150m and 600m sprints at the Bolton United Harriers championships.
He has represented Scotland, whom he qualifies to represent through his father, at different youth levels and has worn the captain's armband for his country.

headline: Man United 'rejected' chance to sign £60m Arsenal target for next to nothing
body: Arsenal are reportedly closing in on a £60million deal for Wolves winger Pedro Neto - a player who Manchester United had the chance to sign for next to nothing
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Manchester United are said to have missed out on the chance to sign Arsenal target Pedro Neto for next to nothing.

The Gunners have long admired the Wolverhampton Wanderers winger and could finalise a £60million deal for the 24-year-old this summer. The Portuguese star joined Wolves in 2019 from Braga, following a loan spell at Lazio. However, before his move to Italy, United were believed to be closely monitoring the promising attacker.

According to The Athletic, United identified Neto in early 2017 and even invited the then-teenager to Carrington. Despite impressing coaches and scouts during an academy game, it took too long for a contract to be sanctioned, it is claimed, leading Neto to sign a new deal with Braga before joining Lazio on a long-term loan.

He later moved to Wolves in 2019 and made his senior international debut a year later. The hesitation is consistent with claims from former club scouts, who say they discovered talents, only for the club to not act quickly enough to tie them down.

The Red Devils were also said to have identified current Bayern Munich and Germany star Jamal Musial and Moises Caicedo, now of Chelsea, early in their development. Lyndon Tomlinson, who served as the assistant head of academy recruitment at United from 2017 to 2021, told The Athletic: "I think it's just being decisive and getting things over the line, that was always the problem.
"In terms of the scouting, the structure and system we had - look at [Alejandro] Garnacho - was good. The reports were there, the process was there. We were just being let down at the end of it.

"That's why I left, ultimately. I was getting frustrated that we were doing reports, I was travelling here, there and everywhere, [and] studying lots of video during Covid. We were making recommendations and then there was just nothing really happening."

headline: Manchester United sign Norway striker Elisabeth Terland from Brighton
body: Terland has established herself as one of the most prolific forwards in the Women's Super League (WSL) since joining Brighton from SK Brann in 2022
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Manchester United have confirmed the signing of Norway international Elisabeth Terland on a free transfer from Brighton & Hove Albion.

The striker has penned a two-year deal with Marc Skinner's side, with an option for a further year. She has established herself as one of the most prolific forwards in the Women's Super League (WSL) since joining Brighton from SK Brann in 2022, scoring 20 goals in 39 appearances for the Seagulls.

On the international stage, Terland has represented Norway at U15, U17 and U19 level, culminating in her inclusion in her country’s Euro 2022 squad. Speaking about her decision to join the Reds, the 23-year-old said: “I’m so honoured to sign for Manchester United and cannot wait to join up with the team.
"Having experienced their excellent fans from the opposing side, I’m really looking forward to having them in my corner this season.”

Manager Skinner added: “Elisabeth is a young player who will bring a fresh dynamic and energy to our team. We are delighted she has chosen to become part of our Manchester United family and look forward to integrating her into our playing squad.”

United finished fifth in the WSL last term and won the club's first major trophy after beating Tottenham Hotspur to the Women's FA Cup. Terland becomes the Reds' third signing of the summer following the additions of Netherlands international Dominique Janssen and striker Melvine Malard from Lyon.

headline: Manchester United confirm second summer signing after successful loan spell
body: The France international spent last season on loan at Leigh Sports Village from Lyon and has now joined the club on a permanent deal
Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
Manchester United have confirmed the signing of forward Melvine Malard on a three-year deal.

The France international spent last season on loan at Leigh Sports Village from Lyon, scoring five goals in 19 Women's Super League (WSL) appearances for Marc Skinner's side. She also featured as a second-half substitute in the Women's FA Cup final as United beat Tottenham Hotspur 4-0 to clinch their first major trophy.
And the Reds have now triggered an option to buy the 24-year-old for an undisclosed fee, with Malard having signed a deal that will keep her at the club until the summer of 2027.

"I am very happy to make my stay here at Manchester United permanent, after this great club and this great city became my home last season," Malard said. "Here I felt loved. Thank you to the fans for welcoming me so well - I will do what it takes to give you even more than last season and I look forward to more winning seasons together."

Manager Skinner added: "Melvine is an excellent character on and off the pitch, with winning pedigree, who we are delighted to see join our Manchester United family on a permanent basis. She has already given our fans some great memories and will no doubt continue to do so in the coming seasons."
Malard has been capped 22 times for France at senior level, scoring six goals. She becomes United's second signing of the summer, following the arrival of Netherlands international Dominique Janssen.
